text: The staff and the food here are amazing. Sasha is the most incredible server and bartender I've ever encountered. She is so engaging and sweet and caring. She never quits being attentive to her guests. It is clear she loves what she does and makes not only me but everyone want to come back. I can't even say enough great things about this location

The scene is definitely better than the food, but I have to give it 4-stars for the happy hour menu.  In total they have over 20 items to choose from - sushi and appetizers, most under $5.  I believe it runs from 3p-7p.  Good looking wait staff and a nice decor.  

Agreed - walking around Kierland is a nice way to work off lunch, or perhaps across the street to the Westin.

We'll be back for happy hour again!

The food is simply awesome! Whether it's fresh sashimi or sushi or cooked stuff, you won't be disappointed. The calamari tempura is a must try! I would have given it 5stars except that the servers are not very attentive to those sitting inside.
Everyone must try the Las Vegas Roll! Best thing i've had on the menu!

I've been quite happy with Ra recently. When they first opened in Phoenix several years ago, the sushi and the service were, in my humble opinion, rather mediocre. Over the years, however, the food has gotten more innovative and become very good. I am a HUGE fan of the Hot Mess (crab sauce baked with jalapenos and sweet eel sauce atop crispy rice patties) and my mom loves their grilled salmon. Their sushi happy hour has quite a bit of variety and the value is pretty good for Scottsdale. Another thing I've noticed at both the Kierland and Old Town locations is that the service is consistently excellent. There was an error in one of our orders recently and our sweet server made it right tout suite! 

Yes, the acoustics....they leave a lot to be desired. I get it: it's a rock 'n' roll sushi bar so loud music is part of the ambience. If you have a hearing loss or if you have difficulty tolerating loud music - be forewarned. I actually prefer to go when it's busier because there are more bodies to absorb the sound of the music. When it's slower, those hard surfaces (tables, glass windows) really make those sound waves bounce. 
Check it out!
Great happy hour specials!!!! Love the crunchy spicy tuna roll....

Quite surprisingly (but in a pleasant way), this joint had some pretty darn good sushi.  I mean, really - landlocked?  Desert?  Where water is uber-scarce?  They put on a good happy hour.  We stuffed ourselves with edamame, salmon and tuna nigiri, squid salad, 'RA'ckin shrimp, Vegas roll, rainbow roll, salmon carpaccio, and a couple other yummies.  Their sake sangria was quite tasty.

One thing I could've done without was the music volume - we had to yell to converse, and I felt like I was in a dance club.  Turn it down, yo!

Have lost count of how many times I've eaten inside and on the patio.  Perfect for chilled healthy food in the AZ summer, especially during Happy Hour when the Sushi & drinks are deeply discounted.  The food & service are consistently fabulous, and the atmosphere fun.  Fun to shop till you drop at the Kierland shops afterward.

Awesome ... One of the Cleanest most executed Bars in the Kierland District.... The Place is Spotless ... Danielle the bartender is like a full time house made ... Great food ... Clean ... Friendly ... Happy Hour ... Thanks ... Was so impressed by the service and Staff ... Literally Danielle the Bartender is like a house cleaner and so friendly... amazing work :)

Stopped by here on Friday for Happy Hour. the sushi was just okay but the Happy Hour drink specials were amazing. We did a bunch of saki bombs and the sushi started to taste better ... hahaha.  My favorite shshi place is here in NJ called Sushi Lounge, after eating here, hard to find another match.

One of my favorite sushi places in az. I'm from California so my sushi standards are high and while there is no comparison to Cali sushi, this is a close second. Ive tried about 6 sushi places in az and been dissapointed and felt totally ripped off but ra has some great deals and quality for your money. 

My favorite is the seared tuna with a sweet onion sauce and their salmon roll with asparagus. Everything is fresh and fast. The bartender Eric ALWAYS takes great care of us and always has some entertaining and morally objective stories to keep us entertained. 

They USED to have a great happy hour menu but they changed it and I am not impressed . I haven't been back for hh since the change and I hope they revert to the original hh menu. 

One nice touch is they are good about pouring your beer/saki in a nice cold/hot glass and refilling it as it goes down. Its the little touches that matter!

The girl at the front desk is so rude at the loment that i payed ibgave her the cash in her hand and when she gave me back my change she just set it in the table instead of handing it to me like i did as well every single timebi said thankyou she replyed back with a mmmhhh that is just plain rude!!!and she didnt even bother to give me a reciept as well i will not be coming back to this location again plus the viva las vegasbroll was not asgood as they used to be a while back....it was just mediocre....

Eh, this place is not good. The food isn't fresh, and it just plain tastes bad. It is far too pricey for how mediocre it is. The service is also not so good, and the servers can be a bit unfriendly.

The only time I would ever come here is when my friends want to go here (even then, I try to tell them not to go!). The happy hour can be okay, but I would definitely rather go somewhere else!

Not authentic, but tasty in its own way.

I go here for happy hour.
I really like the viva las vegas roll.
The crab cakes are of good value.
Fried calamari is a bit bland but worth the volume (big)

Off the happy hr menu, my fav is the scallop dynamite roll.
either you love it or hate it. It took me a couple tries to appreciate it.


the desert roll (bananas fried and topped with fruits, w/ a hint of white chocolate chip) was surprisingly good.

Walking around the mall after dinner is pretty relaxing.

Do not get the tempura icecream here.
It was nasty.

I work near this Ra location, which is the only reason I end up here when I get a craving for a spicy tuna bowl. 

It's just like all the rest...too loud, random happy hour, obnoxious and rude hostesses, nice bartenders and late hours (which is a bonus since everything else short of the OC closes at 9!!!). BUT, I do enjoy that spicy tuna bowl for lunch!!

Also, they do have a 'Nooner Card' that is stamped for each lunch you have and after I think 8, you get a free one! That free one always seems to taste soo good!!

The rest of the sushi is average and predictable and their iced green tea is good. I honestly recommend just getting it to go and saving yourself the rest of the experience!

Had a really good Anniversary dinner here. Big menu but the delivered on everything that we tried. 

Looks like they have a pretty solid happy hour too. I'll definitely be back.

This place is a treat. The service was good, the sushi was on par, and the atmosphere was pleasant. This Ra location could not be in better company (Sapporo's, Cheese Cake Factory, Mastro's Ocean Club, Morton's Steakhouse) all located within walking distance. Our server was very helpful and full of suggestions when we asked for them. It's always an added bonus to have a good looking staff as well. Hannah is by far the best server in the place. She's always quick and very attentive and she has a very pleasant demeanor, and she looks....well, seductive. Unfortunately, as is the case with many chains, the beer line up could use some improvement. How about some Labatte's Blue, Sagres, or Sam Miguel for example? Come to think of it, the wine needs a polish as well. Some Gazela, Lotengo, or Villa Maria would fit in nicely with the current line up. I mean it's not like were trying to dine in North Korean now is it? Overall the food is a solid B. Teriyaki chicken, rolls, tempura, you name it and Ra has it. The rolls are pretty reasonable, especially the regular rolls. As far as proximity goes, Ra is at the top of the heap, considering that Barcelona is just two blocks away.

I work in the area and decided to meet a couple friends for dinner. Wrong decision. The place was busy. But not packed i.e. several open tables that just needed busing. 
The hostesses were unnecessarily rude and threw a lot of sass about how "it is a Friday night". Fine. I can take a rude 17 year old. But I don't think it takes 3 hostesses to do the job. How about clearing the empty tables we've been staring at for the past 40 minutes? 

The ladies room was disgusting. The stalls were out of supplies and in need of attention. 

The waitress seemed like she could care less about her job. 

The food was mediocre (it's Ra we're talking about) and an item was ultimately comped due to the ineptitude of multiple servers. 

Needless to say, there are much better choices around the Kierland area with both better food and service. 

I was so over the whole experience. From beginning to end. Not even worth it for Happy Hour. Meh.

I have been here a few times and it's never stellar. it's always decent, but nothing memorable. tonight was the worst it has been though. the scallop dynamite was almost inedible it was so gross. the chicken kabob things were kinda dry and the chicken was hard and rubbery. the teriyaki  beef was decent but nothing to write home about. the pineapple shrimp salad was great as always!

Ra Sushi was my favorite go to patio at Kierland.  Great people watching location and great food.  However, I have to wonder what they were thinking when they chose the new location on Scottsdale road.  Tried it for the first time today and the food is still consistently great, but the new location is horrible!  Sitting on that patio is like lunching on the side of a highway!  Cars and large trucks roaring past  does not make a relaxing patio experience!  They needed to take some of their renovation dollars and build a wall with water feature to block the view of the road and the noise or at least plant some tall bushes. Not sure if the food is worth the awful patio.  So sad!!  Will miss the old relaxing location.
Put a ToGo order in for a later pick-up. They forgot to put it in. Showed up and they apologized and comp'd the order without me having to complain.

Hostesses need training. We were very disappointed with the level of service that one would expect from the Kierland Commons. We do not mind waiting if the demand for tables is high. But it is grossly unfair to allow other customers to cut in line ahead of folks who have been waiting patiently. Fortunately there are many dining choices in the neighborhood and Phoenix as a whole so we ate a great meal somewhere else. We may try you again someday, but I doubt it. Good luck competing with restaurants that value their customers. There still are a few around.....

In response to an email that I sent directly to RA, I received a prompt reply from the GM. I would like to commend him for his attentiveness to my concerns. I understand that situations may happen when customers feel slighted, but when managers step forward to apologize and attempt to right a wrong, customers should grant them the credit that is due. Thank you Mr Stidham for a job well done! I will visit RA the next time I return to Scottsdale.

It was 9:56 pm... The late night cravings were kicking in. First thought, sushi. I went onto Yelp and "RA" was one of the few that was open late. I decided to give it a shot. I ordered the shrimp calamari tempura roll, shrimp tempura roll, scallop nigiri, sweet shrimp w/head, and spicy tuna handroll. We have never ordered sushi to go, but we figured it would be good considering it was a 25 minute wait. Peering into the bag we noticed there were several containers. Although one stood out to us. Half were green and half were pink. We didn't think anything of it, just thought it was a different style. Let's just say waaaay too much cream cheese. As we took our first bite, we realized we messed up and went to the wrong place. The food was mediocre at best. Scallop was too chewy. Rice was too sticky. This sushi was definitely made by someone who watched too much anime. The interior of the restaurant looked like the red light district too. It is safe to say that I will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone, not even my worst enemy.

Maybe they'll hire some real chefs one day and make some real sushi. xoxo-gossip girl

Went to Ra visiting from out of town. While the sushi is great, the hostess forgot our table, the sushi took about 30 minutes to be served, and when I got ID'd (despite being 23!) they wouldn't serve me because I had a vertical license (which doesn't expire for 10 years in Virginia where I'm from). They couldn't loon at my birth date??? Even speaking to be manager he would t give me the time of day.

Prompt service. In and out. Had a nice time here. Not too packed. Great crowd and the server was quite attentive. The drinks are on point and I have no concerns/issues with the meals we ordered. As with most RA locations, ambiance is Good....Food is good....Service is good. It got the job done.

We just got back to NY from a stay in Scottsdale and loved Ra so much we went there twice!  The happy hour deal is ridiculous.  The Ra'kin Shrimp roll was soooo different from anything we've ever had.  Great food, great service, great ambiance.  Def lives up to NY sushi standards.

This is my favorite RA. The best time to go is for the lunch specials or happy hour! Otherwise I feel that it can be a bit pricey! On Tuesdays they have the by one get one lunch special if you are apart of the "hooked up" email list. My favorite lunch special is the salmon bento box! Service is usually pretty good! Chill atmosphere.
Great sushi place!!! The size of the meat on each piece was huge. Service was excellent. Clean and nice atmosphere. The food was so fresh. Highly recommend!!!

Good lunch and happy hour specials. The sashimi lunch special for about $12 officially gets you 12 slices of fish (with shiso leaves! - love those things)....miso soup, and a salad. Ra's rolls are just average for me...so I don't particularly like ordering them. The sashimi is nice and fresh, though. All in all, Ra is a good value and worth a visit for a simple meal (sashimi).

When I have visited, the restaurant is clean, and the service is good.
Great presentation, great service, great tasting food.  Simple and easy, no hassle tasty food.  Just how I like it.

I really like their sushi and salads. Really good. What I don't like is the extreme wait times for our food to come out, the bad service, and it really annoys me to have to ask for silverware each time and 90% of the time, they forget to bring it to me! Love the food, hate everything else about this place. When I have the patience to put up with bad service, I come here.
Ra is always a fun restaurant. Great food and atmosphere. Love the Vegas roll. Great for Happy Hour!

I have to say its not a Sushi connoisseur's favorite but Its one of our favorite places for happy hour. If you like Hot Saki there only a buck each and It only takes two for me. Meanwhile my wife blows the rest of our budget on apple martinis.  I recomend the Spicy "Crispy" Tuna Rolls, even though they make my teeth sting for some weird reason. Half off a bunch of their delicious apps before 7PM.  If your going to each the Sashimi I would just recomend asking the sushi chef's whats fresh that day and stick to it. Very consistent service. I wouldn't bring kids there but I don't have a problem when others bring theirs.

Sushi good - but nothing special or creative. Appetizers and small plates are very good. Happy hour specials bring us in, although they aren't as good as they used to be. Mediocre to poor service. A lot of activity - people watching place.

Fun Americanized sushi bar.  Usually packed with a 30-something crowd at the bar.  Loud music.  Sushi is average, but what you would expect from a place like this.  Service is good.  If you want drinks with some sushi on the side, this is a great place.  If you want authentic, try Hiro Sushi instead.

I go to this location all the time truly because I think they have the best spicy tuna roll in town, they always get my order perfectly how I want it, and their happy hour is amaze. I always sit at the bar and and the service is just...meh. Like I usually feel invisible. But tonight the bartender seriously was so nice and went out of his way to even suggest other items on the menu to me. That's the whole reason I sit at the bar. To get that kind of service and chat with people a bit. I'm social, what can ya do? Kudos to Khalid for seriously just putting me in a good mood and feeding me all the sush.

What a great experience we had on our FIRST time here.  The service and food were outstanding!  Could not be happier.

My husband gets his hair cut next door, at V's, so I met him there for Happy Hour and sat outside.  We were seated immediately.  Our server was very cheery and helpful.  The place is very clean.  Great Atmosphere.  
Now, if only my husband could get his hair cut EVERY WEEK, so that we can stop in at RA, life would be perfect!

Ordered two of the chicken skewer appetizers.  BOTH came out raw.  The manager never addressed the issue; he never came out to speak to us or apologize.  Instead he simply took them off the bill...after I ate a piece.  RAW CHICKEN is BAD especially when someone eats a piece and was going to serve it to their children.  I addressed the manager with my concern, and he had nothing to say.  We've patronized this business before, but we won't be back...not sane service or same quality.

This sushi bar is wonderful. Marlena was our bartender/waitress and was great. She was so helpful in picking out items that were gluten free and delicious. With allergies its sometimes difficult to tell what's in everything. Both the sushi and drinks were good.
New location is awesome, great indoor outdoor feel. Staff was professional and sushi was really good.

RA sushi has some of the nicest and friendliest staff I've ever experienced. From the hostess' to the waiters everyone's polite and helpful. Plus awesome sushi ontop of that makes it a great place to go.

This place has the worst service and sushi food. I have been to several places but this one takes the cake for being the worst. The waitress disappeared without coming back with the change. Unbelievable.

Decent sushi joint, but the quality of their rolls was not as good as their old town location.  Definitely try the garlic edamame appetizer - it does not disappoint.  For a premium roll, the "Las Vegas" is incredible.

Consistently good sushi.  Service is good, not great, but good.  Today I had nigiri sushi.  Mackerel, halibut, yellowtail, and Hawaiian yellowtail.  Each one was very good.  The spicy lobster roll was very spicy today, which was perfect for me, but might be too much for some.
Place was so dead on a Saturday night. I ordered a simple Chinese chicken salad and it did not taste good at all. Sushi wasn't the greatest either. I would definitely not be going back there.
Had dinner here tonight with 6 in our party.  We ordered shrimp tempura sushi, caterpillar roll, spicy tuna rolls and several appetizers.  Food was delicious and reasonably priced.

From beginning Til end service was horrible. I was better off serving myself rather than my server. She had known my brothers and I were wanting to eat and I went to a table that was already prepped to get my silverware. At first I thought maybe because we came in at 11 and they're about to close in another hour. But it couldn't be that since she was a way better server to two other people who came in later than us. She immediately got them plates and silverware. Once our food came she came midway bringing soy sauce and such. We had only gotten one little bowl to pour it in. We all double dip so I just put my soy sauce on my plate. The food was good, the service not so much. Very tempted to write her name down but I don't know, maybe she was having an off night.

Love this place! Great atmosphere and fast service. If you go I recommend catching the Happy Hour before 7 and order a good spread to share with drinks. Servers are polite and have good recommendations if you are not sure what to order.

My husband and I came here for my bday and our anniversary dinner. I just had twins a few months ago so I hadn't had sushi in almost a year! Way too long to wait if you ask me!!! We got a table on the patio and ordered a ton of sushi off the happy hour menu. Service is what you would expect during a busy happy hour, not horrible but not fantastic either. We had to ask for bowls for our soy sauce twice, which sucked waiting to dig in to my sushi after such a long wait! Sushi was decent as were the prices. We'll be back, celebration or not.

The food: absolutely great.  Started off with the pineapple cheese wontons - really, really good, but if you don't eat the coleslaw they're served on, you missed the best part!  Tempura rolls were something special, the others were quite good as well.   Really enjoyed it!

The service: fair.  The ordering with a checklist thing was annoying, and it didn't work well.  We ordered 4 types of rolls, only got 3, had to ask for the fourth one.  Hello?  It was in writing!

The ambience: Ouch.  Maybe it was because it was happy hour, but as we sat there the music got louder and louder.  By the time we left, it was almost to the point of pain.

Recommendation: Do carryout, so you can enjoy the food without audio assault.
Best sushi happy hour I've been too. Gotta get the crispy spicy tuna and the shishito peppers.  Great patio too.
The Ra in Kierland has one of my favorite patios in AZ. Awesome happy hour.

Sitting here right now. It was an interesting experience.  Apparently now they don't serve sushi without wasabi and ginger?   It's a sushi restaurant! You have to ask for it because they want to "conserve costs"

I had the teriyaki chicken which was served with rubbery chicken and vegetables that matched the chicken. The service was also VERY slow. The only highlight of this place was that it doesn't smell like the old one did.  I do NOT recommend this place and will not be going

I love this place! I will never go to another sushi place again. Service is wonderful, drinks are always spot on, and sushi is always amazing. This is also the first sushi place that doesn't make my husbands stomach upset - so not many can compete with that!

Had the standard rolls - spicy tuna and spicy salmon, plus the mango lobster roll, which was quite a departure from the usual roll flavors. An enjoyable experience during happy hour - prices for rolls are very good.
Delicious food for a great price, short wait times. I recommend the Unagi and Shrimp Tempura rolls and the Pork Gyoza!

The atmosphere was amazing. The sushi was fresh but lacked pizzaz and taste. My order was incorrect and the waitress was busy so i ended up just shutting my mouth. The bathroom was disgusting. The price was decent .. happy hour prices. I wont be back. Major dissapointment.

I'm a fan of RA and this was my first visit to this location. I went with a friend and my daughter during happy hour so I expected it to be busy. When we arrived we gave our name to one hostess and she said they were cleaning a table so we should be seated shortly. About 5 mins later another party of 2 arrived and they gave our table to them so we ended up waiting another 10 mins for a table. We ordered and wanted our appetizer first but they ended up bringing our sushi first and our appetizer last!?? Our waiter was horrible obviously he wasn't hired for being a good waiter. He cared more about flirting with us and other guest. When it was time to pay we split the bill and he never brought back change. I tried getting his attention but he didn't care. I was to fed up to wait for my change. He definitely didn't deserve that $10 tip on a $35 bill. Beside the bad service the sushi was great which is why I give them 2 stars. They need to train the staff with better customer service.

Yum! We love RA and especially their happy hour, we come semi frequently. We got a few rolls and a couple drinks each and the food was great as well as the service. Cole was our server who was training a sweet blonde girl tonight 9/7 who was so pleasant greeting us and also helping Cole. I love going to restaurants that understand service is just as important as the food. We will for sure be back!! Great rolls and great priced drinks for happy hour. Rainbow roll is my FAV!

So tonight I could not have been any happier with the service and experience. I was worried since they closed at 1am that showing up at 12 would be kind of rude so I called ahead of time and the lady I spoke with assured me that coming in around 12 would be okay. I picked my friend up from work and headed right over there to make sure we got there at least by 12. Staff was super friendly and our server was amazing and made my friend and I feel very comfortable. He was really funny and didn't make our visit awkward at all. (You know when you go out to eat and always get that awkward server) well not ours! I believe his name was "Ali". That's the name on my receipt. Such a great server and even though it's a 40 minute drive there, my friend and I both agreed we would be back there soon! Thanks Ali for making us feel welcomed! And thanks Ra for giving us such a delicious dinner.

We came here for the much touted Happy Hour. Pricing was OK. We ordered appetizers, a couple of rolls, and a couple of orders of Sushi.  The service was excellent! Our server was pretty attentive. 

The beef short ribs and shrimp tempura were pretty tasty.  The tempura and calamari rolls were good..............

The nigiri suishi was sliced pretty thinly.  I kind of expected to see a Japanese suishi chef at a Japanese restaurant.........not one in sight.  The chef didn't even know how to hold a suishi knife properly. I was kind of suprised to hear so much spanish spoken behind the suishi bar.  The suishi chef acted irritated whenever we ordered a dish. 

We ended the evening with a tempura cinnamon ice cream concotion. Tasty dish!

Its really loud here.........so if you are looking for a nice quiet evening, this is not he place to come to...............

Food was mediocre. Service was terrible. After getting served our unsweet tea, the waitress disappeared for 10 minutes. No sugar/sweet & low/splenda. Her excuse? We ordered unsweet tea, so she figured we would not want any sweetener. I explained that means I don't want it PRE-sweetened. Took our order, disappeared. Edamame was terrible. Salad & soup mediocre. Sushi sampler was not marked as spicy but somehow had wasabi hidden under each piece of fish. Meat was mediocre. Waitress disappeared again. 

When she came back, she said that her sister had her car with a dead battery and she had to leave, and the manager would take care of us. Nobody ever came by the table.

I wandered the restaurant to find someone to refill my tea. I showed the manager, she walked away. Waiting for the replacement sushi without wasabi took forever. I asked the manager how long does it take to make RAW FISH? No response. No apologies. No discount off the bill. 

When I asked for the bill, the waitress that supposedly had to leave to do something with her sister/car brought us the bill. Odd, thought she had to leave and could not take care of us with the same level of disservice that she had done so far.

Wasted $33 and over an hour and will not return. 

The reason the restaurant is quiet is that we saw very few people actually eating there. That should have been our first sign. Waiting for the waitress to order, we finally got up to leave and she happened to show up as we were heading towards the door. That was our 2nd sign, we should have kept walking. When we finally left after this bad experience, we saw other restaurants nearby that seemed to be full of people eating and enjoying themselves. Pick one of those and save your time and money.
For sushi no where near the ocean, it was pretty darn good. We went during happy hour,  I was very pleased with the variety and 'exclusive to ra' options. The drink menu was great, as well!
Love the Sushi rolls, Ra Rockin Shrimp, and of course we hit up the reverse happy hour you can't beat the prices after 10pm.

Most recent trip here was disappointing. They did not have enough staff for weekend dinner rush. Half the restaurant was empty yet we had a 30 minute wait for a table. Sushi was average. Drinks and service were slow.

This place sucks ass.  Went there on Sunday night to watch game and eat sushi.  Place wasn't busy yet it took the hostess about 10 mins to acknowledge us.  I said we would like to sit at bar and watch game.  She pointed and said you have to go sit at outside bar.  Wtf?

We walk out, sit down and ignored again by staff.  After waiting for another 10 mins we walked across to pizza place and were actually treated like an appreciated customer.

Lost my business for good.

Whenever my girlfriends and I need to go to HH we always choose Ra. They have a BIG HH menu and it goes until 7 which is the latest Ive found. After dinner there is still time to shop around at the stores. It is a great spot and can get busy but they will take reservations which is a huge plus for organizing a successful Happy Hour. The food is always great and we never have to wait too long for our food.

Came here with a large group of around 20 people. RA sushi was very accommodating in finding us a table to fit everyone. 

We came for happy hour and the prices are pretty reasonable for the quality! Rolls were good and their vegetarian options were good as well. I was a big fan of the garlic edamame and wished I had ordered it for myself. 

The waiters did mix up some orders, but it was fine since they were serving such a large group. They even made sure to make our stuff come on time. Also, they split the check for us in 10 ways, which was really kind of them!

I was a little worried to come here because of the reviews about the bad service. I sat at the bar by myself, and I have to say my order was taken quick and the food came out really fast. I had the garlic edemame which was really good, and I tried 2 specialty rolls: viva Las Vegas, and the 2 tuna rolls. The rolls were bland, the rice way too over cooked and with very little flavor. I am a sushi lover and tried Yuma 2 days ago here in Scottsdale (I'm on a business trip) and I have to say the food there is way fresher and tastier. 3 stars for this restaurant.

I only give this place a three because I only come here for the viva Las Vegas roll and nothing else. Amazing dish. Everything else on the menu is mediocre. The staff is decent. I've had a few good servers once or twice but a majority of them hate their lives it seems like. Not bad for drinks if you want a good happy hour. It's super dark in there though and the booth on the far back of the restaurant is destroyed and uncomfortable. They should replace that and make it at least acceptable to seat paying customers. The price isn't bad for happy hour. But nothing is really that great worth paying for.

I'm once again super disappointed with RA. I used to order weekly from this restaurant, but stopped because the quality and quantity has gone down hill tremendously. The last time I ordered take out, I called the manager after I opened the bag and looked at the to go boxes. I always get the RA chips and salsa and it is always a nice decent portion. That time it was significantly smaller. Now, I normally wouldn't call and complain, but the serving size I received was ridiculous. He said he would note my call and my complaint in the manager report and have someone contact me via email. That never happened. So, a few weeks have passed and I decided to give them another try tonight. I ordered what I usually do in hopes of the last time being a fluke. It was WORSE than the last time!! Literally 3 tablespoons of the tuna. I won't be going back which is a shame because I was regular. It shows that the management doesn't care.

We went as a group of four from the office. It took 25 minutes to get our soda and iced tea. 45 minutes after we arrived I had to get up and tell the server we only had an hour for lunch so we would need our order to go. He then came to the table and asked if we would like to just cancel the order. We told him we would rather just have it to go since we didn't have time to go anywhere else to get lunch.
The manager then came by and apologized and again asked if we would just like to cancel. Again we said we would just like it to go. I let my team head back to the office and I stayed to wait for the food. An hour and 15 minutes after walking in the manager came to me with our lunch bagged up. He apologized and said it was on the house.
I felt good at this point that at least they were making it OK. Then I got to the office and found that only three of us got our orders and none of the sides were in the bag. Needless to say a very poor experience all the way around.

So disappointed, I will tell you why.

1. Location. Loved Kierland location and now in a strip mall. 
2. Millennial as host   Asked if we could have a booth, was told they had two reserved.  So a family of four put at small table . Over the course of our meal six were still open. And I am so tired of hearing sorry guys. Stop calling me guy.
3. Menu -completely changed, portions are small, not sure why people come here. If you are a sushi foodie this is not your place. It used to be my place years ago but it has changed drastically.
4. Not friendly. They say hi, but don't stop and talk to me, I am human too. Waiter ok but was doing his job.  
5. Wasted space. They have a huge place where the sushi chef makes food, it would be a great space for food bar stools and TVs
6. Sushi grade is poor. My daughter gagged on her sushi roll.  My roll was not fresh. Seaweed is old.  It should melt in your mouth if fresh 

Sorry for the bad review. We moved to Seattle five years ago. We were back to visit family and friends this week. We used to eat there all the time. Such a letdown.

Their Viva Las Vegas Roll is always good, but the service always leaves you with a bittersweet taste. 
We don't plan on going back!!

I'm not a sushi person but I love RA"s happy hour. There are non-sushi items that I can order and be satisfied with.

The patio area with the high top tables are my favorite place to sit, especially since it's located in the mall, you can ''people watch'' while you eat!

My friend ordered the Las Vegas roll which was a Yelp favorite. I ordered the California Roll, Edamame & Chicken Kabobs. Their happy menu varies from $2 items to $7 items (still not bad for happy hour!)

The white sake sangria was my cocktail of choice and was SO DELISH. It was fruity, fresh and hit the spot.

Not problems with service.
This RA location is located in the Kierland Commons mall next to jCREW.

Great experience!  All their best dishes can be found on their Happy hour menu and it was very reasonably priced. I would recommend Las Vegas roll (unique tasty roll) and get their edamame with a bowl of their garlic spicy sauce to dip in. I used this sauce to dip other rolls in and asked for the recipe on the way out. Will go again!!!
After being seated at a dirty table and being handed dirty menus and a grimy soy sauce bottle, I am so over this place with it's tired menu and hit or miss service. Time to find somewhere new.

Went for Saturday happy hour last night and left with a happy tummy! How can you beat sushi happy hour on Saturday until 7!! :)

*****  Large Kirin Light for $5 (always good :)
*****  Salmon Carpaccio (amazing and a great kick of wasabi)
*****  Sushi (all was fantastic...got salmon, tuna, and yellowtail)
*****  Pineapple Cream Cheese Won-Tons (yummy!!)
***     Viva Las Vegas Roll (Unique, but not for my taste)
**       Crispy Spicy Tuna (soo hard to chew! Rice was not crispy, just tough and chewy)

In the past few months, RA Sushi bar moved from Kierland Commons a little south on Scottsdale BLVD and I was a little bummed.  I actually like the new location though!  Parking is more convenient, plus they are open until midnight which is sort of rare in the early closing city of Scottsdale.

Their staff is VERY professional and friendly.  My waitor had just started working there that week, but I could tell he was very well trained and had previous experience.  We did discover that we were very opposite in terms of political views, however, he was very respectful of my beliefs and I did the same.

They have gluten-free tamari sauce and organic rice as an option.  While this restaurant is typically outside of my uber-healthy restaurant options, the avocado roll and noodle soup works for me.  I sometimes go there to impress special dinner guests or sometimes I go there for my everyday "work on my laptop" nights.

If I had one complaint, it would be that the room is sometimes dark but my eyes adjusted after a few minutes and the music can be a bit loud, but often they will turn down the volume if I ask (yes, I'm getting to the age where the music is too loud).

This is definitely an upper-end sushi place and offers the same high quality that you would expect from other RA Sushi locations.  Check the website for Sunday Brunch and Happy Hour specials.

I've found another great sushi restaurant. This wonderful little restaurant offers a nice happy hour selection of some of the top shelf sushi items. Sitting outside on the patio at 7pm in the cool breeze of Scottsdale affords anyone the pleasure of simply relaxing at the end of the day. We ordered several including the Spicy Shrimp roll, Viva Las Vegas, and Zonie Roll. You can't go wrong with this place. Our waiter 'Dan' recommended a couple of drinks Blushing Geisha and the Dragon Bite. Even though this is a chain, the quality of drinks and food make this a unique stop in Scottsdale.

Since the move from Kierland the overall quality and experience has completely gone down. I've tried the new location three times now with months between the second and third time. I went during lunch, was not busy, took 40 minutes for a California roll for goodness sakes. Ordered edamame to go and that took 20 minutes. Whatever happened to them during the move, this is a place I will no longer go to. I used to go once a week! They've got to get things figured out here!!!

Great food, ~good service, cool atmosphere, loud hard surfaces (which seems to the trend) a little pricey.

Yeah, I would go back

So. freakin. good.  Definitely hit up lunch hour you'll get the most bang for you buck! 
Sushi is fresh and delicious.. Couldn't ask for better!
My favorite sushi in Arizona! Not always the best service, but worth the drive for the food. Good happy hour deals and delicious desserts

Stopped by today for some Sushi with my heterosexual life partner.

We were seated by the hostess quickly but waited ten or more minutes to be waited on.  The hostess noted we had not been servedand went to find a waiter.  There was a delay even after that point.

This did provide us with plenty of time to get our order of sushi.  When our waiter arrived he tried to leave after taking  the drink order.  I stopped him and had him take our sushi order before he wandered off again.

This level of service is what I would expect in Greece where literally I have had to chase waiters down to get a beer.

The sushi when it arrived was good.  We enjoyed the Las Vegas roll and the Gojira roll (GoJiiiirrrraaa!!!!) the most.

The fried banana desert was splendid.

Overall the quality of the food was shadowed by the at best indifferent service.

I just followed the recommendation from FourSquare which also offer a free Edamame as an appetizer, and I'm glad I did. They open late even weekdays, which is convenient for me who often end up with looking for a place to eat a dinner after 9pm.  A lot of healthy choices with reasonable price and decent volume. I will probably go back there when I go Phoenix again next time. But Sushi Nigiri from a la carte menu are pricy. I did not see any Asian Sushi Chef in the Sushi counter, which is not very common in the area I live (MD, DC, VA), but I suppose that is not unusual in Phoenix. Sushi quality was still pretty good.

I have family in Scottsdale and I think that I've eaten here literally every time I see them.  Last night was no exception, so off to Ra's happy hour we went.  They've recently changed their menu, so the happy hour offerings were different as well.  They have a few more drinks on special, but I went with the white sake sangria which is always a favorite.  Edamame was good per usual.  But, the new offerings are what blew us away.  The shisito peppers were probably my favorite part of the meal.  They were simple, but every bite was spicy and filled with garlic. Also new and garlicy, were the garlic sugar snap peas.  These were cooked well and very good.  The dengaku tofu is an old favorite.  I have to praise Ra for the amount of vegetarian dishes on their happy hour.  There were more options than we ended up ordering and that is extremely rare on most menus.

My only complaint with the new menu was the vegetable roll.  They seemed to have gotten rid of a standard veggie roll with cucumber, carrots, and avocado wrapped with nori.  The new roll is wrapped in rice paper and had artichoke hearts, and iceberg lettuce and a few other things mixed in.  I like that they tried to give it a new spin, but sometimes you really just want the classic.

Leaps and bounds ahead of every other sushi spot in the Phoenix area (especially Sushi 101) as far as taste goes. 

The atmosphere is always great, the service is generally quick, and the food is amazing.

I was a little put off by one of the sushi chefs preparing rolls with a band-aid on his ungloved hand. I realize that they have a license to prepare food without gloves, but having a bandaged hand preparing it was a little unsettling. If my food had been prepared by this sushi chef, I probably would have left 2 stars.

Other than that, the Las Vegas Roll and the Tootsy Maki are both absolutely delicious.

Ra is pretty good. It isn't as good as sushi brokers but it's good. We went at happy hour Saturday and they were out of a couple appetizers already...how is that possibly on a Saturday before dinner? I could understand late at night after a busy night, but 4p on a Saturday? Oh well. 
They also don't have fried rice? What's up with that? They have fried rice spring rolls but won't sell just fr. That's a normal app for an Asian place. It would be nice to see more meat appetizers as my friend I usually go with doesn't like seafood. We like going here because of the drinks and app specials. I like the sushi here, but they should have more variety for people like my friend who don't want to just eat sushi. 
The service was pretty good. It wasn't the best but it wasn't bad. 
Overall, I'll keep coming to Ra when they have happy hour since the normal prices are a bit high.
Dinner tonight.  Food was okay but wasn't anything too special, service wasn't great.

I could care less about being seen in Scottsdale, what my friends look like, and how cool we look when we hang out together. This is why I don't go to this place more than once every two years!!!! That being said, I do like their food. Its pretty good for sushi. But, the music is too loud, its pretentious as all get-out, the staff is too cool for their own good (Hey Bambi... You work in a frickin' restaurant), and its too much of a scene! Can I just have two of the Las Vegas' to go without all the crap?

This is a cool sushi restaurant that serve good sushi.  I have had much better, but for a fun vibe with outside seating, it's not bad. 

I like the one in Kierland and would recommend checking it out.  It is not my favoriate sushi in AZ, but if I'm in a pinch, it will work.  

What I don't like is that the outside table will fill up for sport games on TV and the people continue to lurk and refuse to give up tables.  Granted, it's a game, but the sushi place is not a sports bar.  They should require the people to order so many drinks or some much food every hour to maintain the table... that's my only rant!

Enjoy.

This was the only real sushi place I tried while in AZ, and I was impressed, considering I believe MI has some tough places to beat! Lots of seating in the dining area, bar, and patio. Pretty lighting with the red sphere lanterns on the patio. Super friendly and welcoming staff and fast service. Loved that their ginger is fresh and not artificially colored pink. Here are items we ordered and loved:

Garlic edamame
Miso soup
Hot mess-appetizer (my fav, must try!!)
RA'ckin roll (bomb)
Crunchy shrimp tempura roll (loved it)
California dream roll (least favorite roll Bc of the fishy tasting snow crab salad mix that comes on top with the wonton chips).

I headed to Ra for a happy hour with a couple of friends last week.  We sat outside and were quite comfortable, thanks to the well placed heaters.  Our server was nice enough, but not very engaging.  

We really enjoyed the pineapple cream cheese wontons - enough that we ordered a second serving!  The spicy salmon and Tootsy Maki rolls were delicious, but we weren't very impressed with the Vegas roll... it had an overwhelming strong mayo taste.  Otherwise, it would've been a very tasty roll though.

Not a bad happy hour spot, if you are looking for some cheaper sushi, but the drinks are still pretty pricey.   At the very end of our meal, our server brought over two drinks that she said they "wanted us to try" - nice, but there were three of us... one of us was supposed to just watch the others drink, I guess?  And unfortunately, the free drink was absolutely unpalatable - some kind of strawberry sake martini? Avoid it if at all possible.  Instead, the Mango Martini and the Shiso Naughty are much better options!
The service was excellent and the food was even better. Our server Bryce took great care of our complicated order. We will be back

Hmmm sushi in Scottsdale, Arizona...

The goods - there is usually little wait, the music is good, and the sunday specials rock my sox.  The staff is usually attentive and down to earth, and the food usually comes out pretty quick.  It is hard to find a good mojito in this darn town let alone anywhere, and they make a MEAN mango mojito.  The crazy monkey roll is my absolute favorite with a lot of flavor, but its definitely an acquired taste (if you are a nigiri lover, this is probably not the one for you).  They are open late night too which is great and hard to find in the n snottsdale area.

The bads - they are not always consistent with their fish.  Sometimes its great, other times it absolutely blows --- the nigiri is a toss up.  A seasoned sushi-er knows when something is not right; I put a piece of nigiri in my mouth that tasted way off, and what do you know it came right back up about 10 minutes later. Normally, I would swear to never return to a place that caused unnatural regurgitation, but the manager was quick to rectify the situation, covering our food on our bill and offering us a voucher for a free dinner of whatever we wanted next time we came back in [this however did not go as planned - check out my review on the ra downtown] Another time I found a bone in my salmon nigiri, definitely not ok.  The scene here too is simply obnoxious at certain hours, not as bad at this location though than others.  

Its worth a try, and I do still dine here, but your money is only worth it during the happy hour specials.

I love, love, love their Vegas Rolls. And now they are on happy hour menus!  Whoo hoo!
My girlfriends and I went recently for happy hour and we found a seat outside under the mists.  Food and drinks came out super fast, and service was great.  I love when a great sushi chain doesn't lose their service and quality of food.

I don't know what happened to this spot, atmosphere is still great, but I was there for lunch a few days ago, ordered vegas roll + spicy tuna & they were both terrible..literally my friend and I had maybe 1 or 2 rolls each..bland, no taste & stale..hard to find good sushi in this town these days..

I went here with no great expectations only because iv'e heard that RA is chain and while being from SoCAl here on vacation, chain is not what I am looking for. The hostess, server (Derek) where amazing! unbelievably helpful from the moment we walked in! The food was great! SO great that we asked to talk to the manager (Nick) he was great also! gave us the 411 on the happening spots in the area.... most talk other places down he is very knowledgeable of the area. I will absolutely return here and highly recommend it! great atmosphere, staff and food, thanks everyone!

Best sushi in town ! Must try the pineapple  wontons as an appetizer and the maki split for desert. The maki split is an imitation of a sushi roll but as a fried banana topped with a kewi, strawberry, whip cream and drizzed with straw berry/chocolate syrup !!!! It's to die for !!!

I don't know if it's Arizona or RA but the service here was exceptional. I've never seen anything like that - especially in NYC. 

First of all, garlic edamame? Who came up with that? Genius. 

They took a little long to get some sauces out to us so the manager came over, apologized and took some $$ off our bill. It was totally unnecessary but totally appreciated. 

Great food, fun space.

I have eaten hear over the years. Most of the time on Happy hour. The menu for happy hour always changes and seems to be decent. Good flavors, ok size. The reason why it only gets 2 stars in my book. Turn the fucking music down! The tech music they play sucks! It is hard to hold a conversation with that shit turned up to "11" If you can handle that then enjoy.

If I was able to give no stars I would I come here constantly with my boyfriend and eat normally 30 minutes to an hr before they close and we were turned away this evening 35 minutes before closing and told they weren't taking any food orders.

RA is always fast and easy and open at odd hours when you're craving sushi so that's always a plus. The outdoor seating in the Tempe RA is nice. The service and the RA on Scottsdale road is so bad that it's funny. You order a drink and it comes out with your last course. It's happened every time I go. The servers are always so sweet but they have no idea how to serve in a decent time frame. The food is always okay.

Slow Service. 

This has been our family's favorite restaurant but over our last three visits we have become so frustrated with the predictably slow service that we won't return.  We wanted to give it one last chance, but last night was our last visit.  

The food was great as always, but the service is so slow you feel as though your business is being taken for granted.   We ordered cocktails first, which took ages to arrive.  Our starter arrived in a reasonable amount of time, but no soy sauce.  The server did not return and to our amazement there was not soy sauce on any of the outdoor tables, so we had to walk into the main restaurant to ask for it.   

Nobody else ordered a second drink or desert as we were now sitting so long we were physically uncomfortable and just wanted to be out of there.  Waiting for the check was another unreasonably long process.  

Unfortunately, poor service has become the standard at this location and with so many other choices in the area we will not return.

We went to the new location and love the bar and better location.  Was seated and no one helped us.  My son asked someone walking by, if they could get our waiter.  He apologized and said it was not his area but would take care of us!  Isidro was fantastic and made sure we were taken care of!!

Food was great!  We will be back..

Very disappointing experience...

Have been to Ra Sushi a number of times over the years and have had an overall positive view of the restaurant as a whole. Although, after my recent visit to this particular Ra Sushi location I am entirely done with them. 

Was in the area and saw the restaurant from the street and decided to drop in. I was by myself so decided to sit at the bar. First, it took a while for me to be greeted... From the get go the bartender (Jennifer) wasn't warm, friendly, nor accommodating. The initial interaction with the bartender would hold true for my entire experience. 

After being greeted I put in my drink order. The drink did not take long and was actually made very well. The issue was the horrendous customer service. I was three sips into my drink and the bartender (JENNIFER) brought me my tab.... Mind you, this was around 8:00 PM on a weekday... no close coming around the corner nor did I indicate I was there for just one quick drink. This coupled with the fact that she had an overall rude attitude towards me was upsetting. No customer ever wants to feel rushed. 

While at the bar I was never checked up on one time. No, "how's the drink..." "Here is your bill. No rush sir." "Would you like anything else?" "Thanks for coming in" ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. I was also never asked if I wanted a menu. I received dirty looks to boot??? 

I typically like to stay on topic and never reference other reviews as a 3rd party... Although, one needs only read through this restaurants review to see they have a major issue with service that they have obviously yet to properly address. 

I will not be spending my hard earner money with this business again. If you value good customer service and professionalism I recommend you stay away from Ra Sushi. 

Disappointed.

I only gave this 3 stars because of the taste of the food.  RA always has a great selection.  This was the first time going to this particular location.  We were very disappointed.  Our waiter took more than 4 minutes to even come to our table and greet us and take our drink orders. Just a little information before I go on....this was at 3pm on a Saturday and they were not busy AT ALL.  He finally gets our drink order (sodas) and it takes him a while to deliver them.  We place our food order, several minutes later we get our food but never received our soups as our appetizer.  That got corrected after bringing it up to our server.  Now all our drinks were empty and needed refilled.  We had to flag him down and ask for refills, he had his hands full so would be "right back".  He didn't come back, we had to again track him down to get more soda.  While we were waiting I went to the restroom, it was gross, papertowels overflowing and trash on the floor.  The restaurant itself looked a lot like this also.  There were wrappers and debri all over the dining area.  You would think being in North Scottsdale Keirland things would look nicer.  We will be sticking to the south scottsdale location where we know we get great service and the place is clean!

My wife and I came here for Arizona Restaurant Week. 

We've never been to RA Sushi before, so we figured we'd check it out. 

This is at the Kierland Commons location in North Scottsdale. We walked in and I thought it looked really cool inside. I liked the atmosphere and thought the red lights were a good touch.

Our waitress was nice, but really didn't understand the AZ Restaurant Week menu. She gave us conflicting information about it. It had been going on for at least a week but she said we were her first customers to order off that menu. Maybe she should have been trained in it better. Whatever, not a HUGE deal.

We got the pot stickers for the appetizer. It was good. No complaints there. But it reminded me of the pot stickers you sample at Costco. I wonder if they got it from there. 

We ordered the Las Vegas roll and some other sushi assorted platter. The Vegas rolls were way too messy. I didn't know how to eat it with my chop sticks. Kubuki is better. The California rolls were super tiny too. I had no clue what the other thing was. I think it was salmon on top of white rice? Not impressive.

Then came desert. We got the green tea ice cream. I couldn't finish it because it tasted too bitter. My wife informed me that it wasn't bitter, but I thought it was. Maybe my pallete is off? 

Anyway, it was overpriced. Our server was nice, but she didn't really go above and beyond. Would I come back? Probably not.

In regards to Laura w , Danielle is the best bartender at RA. Come Into RA on a weekly basis and make sure Danielle is always working before I go in. She is always extremely attentive, sweet and knowledgable.

Really, Ra? 12??!  That's TWELVE open tables on the patio at 5pm on a Saturday and you can't seat a table for two because they're ALL reserved?!? We would probably only take up a table for 45mins max as we had to get a babysitter to get out for this evening. 

Surprise! Still tables open when we left!

I like the happy hour menu, location and the service. Jayme was really helpful explaining items and attentive during our meal. The food came out perfect. This is a reliable fun delicious dining experience. I recommend it.
Server was awesome! Food was fast and delish. Beer was cold. What more can you ask for?

Been eating here since 2004! With sooooo many sushi bars opening on every corner, this RA still holds great quality fish and has an awesome staff! It's my go to happy hour if on sushi mode! Amazing food and drinks and staff!

Ps In oct. Kierland location moves to Scottsdale and thunderbird shopping center location! Can see it from Scottsdale road!

This place was always great. The atmosphere is energetic and the prices are very reasonable! Sometimes the service lags when they get super busy but the management really makes things right, should there ever be a problem. Sitting at the sushi bar is always a great experience too! Especially if it's a busy night; there's usually a seat opening up there pretty quickly!
First time dining here. Food was good, service was great. Definitely would come back.

My daughter and I had a reservation and we were seated right away.  Nice atmosphere and the server was friendly and was really familiar with the menu.  Food was very good and drinks were great!   Service- not so great.   Appetizer came out before our drinks then my daughters plate came 10 minutes before mine.  The manager comped my meal.  When paying the tab, server came back to the table without my change!

Needs improvement in service for sure!
Only complaint is the wait time for a table outside in this beautiful weather. Otherwise this place succeeds everytime!

Ra has been a longtime favorite of ours. Thursday night was a huge disappointment. The atmosphere is horrible at the kier land location. Music was so loud we had to yell at each other in the booth. We asked the waiter Dustin if it could be turned down a little, he laughed and said the manager will turn it up, and they did! The manager was lance. Also, they changed the happy hour menu which is really surprising since it has been a valley favorite for years. I may not be back.

Not the best sushi in the world but I appreciate the value of their lunch specials as well as the charm, panache and mystique of the bartenders. 

Tip - They also make a fantastic squid salad.

My husband and I have been going to Ra Sushi for the last year.  We had not been in awhile and decided to take advantage of the happy hour before the big Saturday night rush. 

Although the happy hour menu looks like it has been expanded, the quality of food has clearly diminished.  Our sushi roll (spicy yellowtail) looked like it was rolled by a 3rd grader.  Additionally, it was barely filled with any fish!  I can't believe that a reputable restaurant could serve something that looked so puny.  

We will not be returning in the near future.

By far this is their best location as I have frequented all their establishments. You will never be short of good energy, consistently good food and really good service. Bravo to my server last night for her finesse in managing the patio area with always a sweet smile and thoughtful apologies for being not as attentive as she would like. The back up bussers are always spot on to clear the evidence of my gorging. Thank you for letting me look dainty!

This is my fave HH location. Great people watching. We all know their lunch specials are the bomb, especially the bento boxes. My faves that aren't on HH are the lobster spring rolls and the Gojira roll. Otherwise, stuff yourselves on the Vegas roll, the garlic citrus yellowtail and the rainbow roll. Perfect flavors to compliment the potstickers and your Sapporo beer!
Love this place! We came here after seeing a late movie and the reverse happy hour is amazing!!! The service was wonderful & food was fresh and amazing even at 10pm!

RA Sushi is a fun place to go and it has a great Happy Hour!

We came here yesterday on Father's Day for brunch and were seated very quickly. I am not a big fan of the Americanize sushi craze. I was brought up on the old school counter seats and conveyor belt setup, with different colored plates. But, RAs does a nice job and has a well deserved reputation for good sushi and as an after work watering hole.  

We started with Edamame, which was very flavorful.  Our waiter was eager to help, offering to tell us everything he knew about the menu and sushi.  Over the top for sure, but very nice just the same.

The sushi portions are the Americanized thick cut with an exaggerated piece of fish that hangs over the rice on either side. I was less impressed by California Rolls which are made with a crab salad, rather than strips of crab.  It also had a fishy taste. If you are sushi purist, you might not enjoy it. 

We skipped their famous Sake Bombers, since it was before Noon. But we had a very nice Father's Day and enjoyed the atmosphere of RA's.  Our bill came to a reasonable $19.00 per person, including taxes and gratuities. So, Three Stars "A-OK' in Yelp-ese.

Had lunch with the fam here and we were all super pleased with most everything! We had a seaweed salad, vegas roll(*best!), spicy tuna roll and split two lunch specials. Ma got pork katsu bento box and it finally came out as sis and I were finishing the bowl that I had ordered full of raw fish. We were a bit scared at first, but the shrimp, tuna, yellowtail and salmon were in perfect bite sized pieces over rice and accompanied by tasty vegetables. It was a winner even to sis who claims to hate salmon. The pork was a letdown, but saved by the salad's it was served over and next to. Ixnay the pork and everything was perfecto!

Slowest service ever. It's a bad sign when the table that was seated after us gets their meal before we even get our drinks. Took 10 minutes before our server came to greet us. She hardly came by and we had to flag her down to put in another order which took 25 minutes for 1 roll of sushi to be delivered. At the same time, we also asked for our bill  because we had already been there for an hour (2 rolls and an entree of noodles) and figured we'd get our bill before we lose her again. It took another 20 minutes between getting the bill and her swiping our card. What was supposed to be a nice evening out turned into an hour and a half of the slowest, most inattentive service I've had in quite some time. We've been here once before and had great service and sushi so it was unfortunate my experience last night was subpar.

I Love RA!!  I usually go there for lunch.  They have a great lunch menu with bento boxes, bowls, and sushi or sashimi combos.  I also LOVE the veggie tempura!  They also have a great happy hour menu and pricing.  I come here as often as I can.

I have been coming here for years and never considered it an exceptionally amazing but loved the happy hour and their crazy monkey roll. Well I decided to come here just for that last weekend. It was not busy at all which is very strange as it was prime time on a weekend night and we were seated outside. Let me bottom line it: the food has completely gone downhill and the service is TERRIBLE. Our waiter was nice but seemed kind of new because he would rarely come around to check on us... like 20 minute intervals at least. My husband didn't like his iced green tea so he asked he send it back, he forgot my husband's replacement drink order until we asked again for it. He said he "comped" us for the iced green tea even though we drank hardly any of it and asked for it to be sent back. He never brought us water, I had to walk inside and ask the bartender for water. He forgot the soy sauce and ramekins for our sushi, so my husband had to walk inside and ask for this as well. We're not particularly picky people but when we get a night out we expect basic service. 

Now on to the food, I used to LOVE the crazy monkey rolls. I mean I craved them so much it's the reason I went there last weekend. To my disappointment, it was sloppily put together and there was more cream cheese in there than anything. It actually did not even taste good.

Long story short, due to the terrible service and decreasing quality of their food we will not be returning unless it only for happy hour drinks or something. There are far better sushi places in the area with comparable prices, Sakana is amazing for example.

To say we were utterly disappointed with our service experience this evening would be an understatement.  Tonight was our 4th dinner this week with Ra supporting Nicky's Week and the work of St. Jude Children's Hospital.

From the moment our server Dan walked up to our table with a black eye, to his rubbing his eyes while he was taking our order began this unfortunate experience with his equally blase attitude.  Dan proceeded through our dinner service to walk to the end of the bar and lift his shirt to show off his stomach, which he was apparently impressed with, to one of his co-workers.

Empty water glasses, empty ice tea and having to flag him down to ask for the check was simply the icing on the cake.  This was all under the less than watchful eye of what we had to assume was a male manager who was equally disheveled in his appearance.  We can only surmise he was a manager based on hearing him apologize to the table behind us for their dissatisfaction.  When we left the restaurant "the manager" was comfortably seated at the end of the bar doing absolutely nothing.  

We left a shockingly low tip that hopefully conveyed our displeasure to Dan and left the remainder as an increased donation to the memory of Nicky and the great work of St Jude.  Over the years we have certainly come to expect much more from a service standpoint than your Kierland team offered this evening.  We will not be back to this location in the near future.

Sushi is not that good to be having such terrible service. 

After showing up at the wrong location to just be told "this happens all the time" instead of just taking us at that location we were told we HAD to drive 22 minutes to the other location to keep our reservation. You would think since this happened all the time they had some sort of procedure in place but no.  

So after driving to the other location we were seated quickly (I called and told them what happened so they knew we were going to be late) but sat without being greeted or offered water for so long that we might as well have just not been seated yet. 

When we finally were approached by our server (Jayme) she stopped by the table next to us and began a full conversation while placing napkins on our table without saying a word to us but still talking to the table next to us. Not to mention after she finishes her conversation offers no apology or explanation for her terrible greeting. It was downhill from there. After taking another 10 minutes to retrieve a drink menu, we saw her a total of four times with the worst fake happy attitude it actually made us uncomfortable.

At the end of the day there are way better places in Scottsdale to get Sushi with WAY better service, so why go to RA.

Went there at what I thought was late for the area, 10pm, but little did I know the party was just getting started. Sat at the bar. Ordered their late night HH yellowtail nigiri (2 pieces) and seared tuna. Yellowtail was so good I ordered a second round. Danielle the bartender (how could I forget her name with some unexpected drunk guys coming in and shouting her name every couple of minutes) was really welcoming. By the time I left the bar had been half full and a table of 8+ was being served. I'm not staying long in the area but very tempted to come back again!

p.s. They automatically served ginger/wasabi with the meal, so I'm not sure what a previous reviewer was complaining about.

Visit this place almost weekly. Frequently enjoy happy hour with and crispy spicy tuna roll and chili ponzu yellowtail. Always reasonably priced and is good quality sushi. Have bad better have had worse but it's very good for the price.
Love RA.... This RA is small & has a cramped feeling to me compared to Chandler .. Love sake sangria... The sushi .. All good:-)
Friendly and attentive staff...efficient service, fresh fish, diligent preparation practices, good prices (take some time on the $25 menu or happy hour listing) and convenient location... enjoy!

Pretty bad experience....I was here with 4 friends and I guess the bartender had an issue with my girlfriend but I have been a bartender for 11 years and no matter what you must leave that at the door and as a fellow worker in the quarter you should want me to give raving reviews. I can't....the man bartending was amazing he made the experience but the girl her name was Danielle she wade a point to speak to the manager who personally came over and had the audacity to ask if my date had been kicked out of r.a. which she had not....and as a professional I find this to just be vile....how dare you ruin our celebration for a personal vendetta and how dare you support it... I have been a longtime guest and I will never patronize this place again...sorry ra....but you deserve and could be better

Got here about 11 pm , and lucky me it was happy hour  . Music was good , only one bartender at that time and didn't see a server , on other words, it looks like it doesn't get that much business at that time (happy hour for a reason) , bartender was friendly , took care of us , food was delicious .. I recommend the Ra-ckin shrimp .. That was just tasty . I thought I was going to get very small portions because of the happy hour deal , but I was wrong . I did dislike the lighting (just a personal oohing) too dimmed for me . 
Small bar , they do have a nice patio though . I'll have to come back in the day to see how the experience is .
Ok rolls. Good but not too memorable drinks. Recommend it for the happy hour.

Came in Friday Night and was greeted warmly by like 3 hostesses at the door. Our server was super sweet and attentive... almost too attentive. We ordered the edamame, rainbow roll, tootsy roll and tuna roll. Everything was perfect and tasted fresh!! My sangria was a little bland but overall it was definitely a 5 star experience
LOVE THE NEW LOCATION AND THE PATIO IS AWESOME! The bar is spectacular!!!! Food seems to taste even better!!!!!! The staff and manager are awesome! Way better atmosphere than Snotty Sapporo!
Very pleasant experience here!  The food was outstanding, and our waitress was quite attentive and patient when we weren't ready to order...even after 20 minutes.  Great Happy Hour menu as well.

I wish I could give it 3.5 stars. This place has a great atmosphere. Good value (during happy hour especially). The edamame was over cooked tonight but usually is spot on. Wed they have a deal where you choose 4 small plates plus an order of edamame for $30. Also have happy hour menu and drink specials until 7 every night (I think all day Sun as well). The chili ponzu yellowtail is always amazing. Service always good. Solid sushi meal always.

I'm not sure why they change there location but the old one was fine 
This place is empty and not very fun 
The stuff move super slow even if there is no ppl there 
I love the sushi here because it's fresh and taste good
My problem is that I never get what I order 
It's always the second time I ask it 
And they are cheap on there spicy mayo 
If you go there that fine just keep it simple for them ,if not you will get something else

I went with my girlfriend and I ordered the spicy mitso soup and she ordered the potsticker soup, and we shared some endamame.  Both soups were big portions and absolutely fantastic.  Was told by the GF that the spciy mitso was similar to something she had in Japan.  

The other great thing was their happy hours:  10 to midnight.  So while surrounding restaurants are cleaning their kitchens to close for the night, this place is just getting started.

Now for the bad:  we never got around to ordering a main, because of the ghetto Muzak that was being piped onto the outdoor patio area, inside, even in the bathrooms you could not get away.  Are these people serious?  Nothing like hearing the lyrics "you gotta lick it, before you stick it, you gotta get it soft and wet so we can kick it" (yes, that song from a previous decade is now in a cheesy extended club mix version playing exclusively at Sushi RA)....how nice it is to hear such words as you contemplate which raw fish to order.  I don't think so.  I looked around but did not see a dance floor...although I did notice a couple behind us with 2 young girls which made the whole scene seem entirely inappropriate.  I thought for certain they must be offended, but realized much later, during a short break in the music, that they were speaking French and seemed entirely oblivious to the lyrics being pounded out.

The management of this place need to mature a little bit.  I have been to places like this in Manhattan, where they think they can survive on great food and reputation forever, and that people will tolerate any attitude and disrespect for the sake of it.  

The bottom line: this establishment serves 5 star food while pandering to 1 star clientele.  I was surprised to hear they have been around for 8 years.....

So over rated. 
I'm from San Francisco- I have high standards for my sushi. 
I especially dislike sub-par fish in a place that tries to look/act swanky. 
This reminds me of a sleazy date spot- oh wait it is!

I prefer my secret spot in Avondale for better prices, fresher fish, and more attentive staff.

Okay so before everyone gets all JUDGEY about the impossibly high rating I gave a sushi restaurant in Arizona that's part of a chain owned by Benihana (THE HORROR!), hear me out.  My office is located in the Kierland Commons. This can be nice when I want to blow half my paycheck at H&M during my lunch break, but it's not so nice when I NEED to blow half my paycheck if I want to be able to go somewhere walking distance from my office for lunch. Originally, I thought my most reasonable options were a $7 Asian Chicken Salad at Chloe's Corner or crossing Scottsdale Rd to get to Chipotle. That is, until I ventured over to RA today and saw what I had been missing.

For starters, they have some amazing lunch specials.  Yes, they are pricier than Chipotle but in the grand scheme of sushi, they're pretty damn good. They have a Sashimi Lunch combo that is four pieces of salmon, tuna, and yellowtail with a miso soup and a salad for like $12.  Their Bento lunches come with so many things I can't even remember them all and cost like $9.  For the area (this mall in particular), these lunch prices are incredibly reasonable.

What I got today, the Tuna Squared Salad, isn't even on the lunch menu and it totally blew my mind that for a couple bucks more than the tuna-mayo salad over greens I get at Chloe's (which is delicious BTW but that's not the point), I could be getting a huge portion of greens topped with about 5-6 pieces of seared ahi, about 5-6 slices seared sushi-grade albacore, avocado, and cashews.  These are all very expensive things!  This should be a very expensive salad! But it's $10 and it's glorious.

Oh one more thing that I probably won't be getting while we're in the triple digits but I have had before and it's delightful: Miso Hot Soup.  Picture a huge miso soup full of shrimp and tofu and mushrooms with with a kick strong enough to clear your sinuses.  Plus it comes with these fried rice balls (I usually get it to go and they come on the side) that are surprisingly delicious. I always think I can save some calories and not eat them, but it never happens. Those suckers are in the soup by the second spoonful and gone before I'm half done, they're just that good.

All in all, no, I don't go to RA for mind-blowingly fresh, melt-in-your-mouth sushi. But I do go for decent lunch options at prices that allow me to blow money during my lunch break the way God intended: Shopping.

I'm really impressed with this place.  I think some people may give it bad marks because it's sums up everything beautiful and wrong with Scottsdale in one meal.  The location in Keirland, lends RA to be a haven for the Scottsdale douche elite to hang out at the chain sushi restaurant with mexican chefs, order a dynamite roll and reminisce about the time they ate the freshest yellow fin at the Grand Wailea resort on Maui.    And I got to say, I saw a couple of them there.  But sushi is a funny thing.  You can't fake freshness no matter how hard you try, and the fish here tastes like it was flown in from Japan, Alaska, or Hawaii this morning.  Blows places like Yume out of the water.  My wife and I wondered in on a Saturday afternoon and to our delight happy hour was in effect.  Long story short, we ordered a lot of nigiri, ponzu marinated sashimi, a couple of hand rolls, gyoza, and 4 beers for a total of $64 including tip.  I'd definitely come here during non happy hour, but I have to say, this is going to be my new place for Saturday afternoon indulgences.  You see, like the mexican sushi chefs that work here, Scottsdale is a bit of an anomaly.  There's no real culture here other than the one that's been put up by developers.  All the authentic real grit that resides in the Downtown Phoenix, has been washed away, polished up, and desert that used to be considered no mans land nothing is now the height of luxury in the Valley and its only getting better with time.  I guess what I'm trying to say is that beyond the Pottery Barns and the overpriced Hemingway Cigar Shop bullshit, there are local businesses that have adapted and learned like the chefs at RA and they are turning out spectacular food and doing it really well.  Don't let any other reviews change your mind.  Come down to Kierland on a hot day, sit at the RA Sushi Bar, order a cold beer, a couple pieces of maguro, and suck up all the Scottsdale ambiance you can muster.  Douche bags included.
This is my go to sushi place for my husband and I. The sushi is great and the servers are always wonderful! They always make sure we are happy and our water glasses are full! Great service and food!
Best sushi in town. I usually don't like that fishy stuff but hell.... I'll take it! Plus there drinks are always mixed on the heavy side.

The good:

Happy Hour! Great quiet location(not directly next to a busy street), beautiful woman left and right, great club like atmosphere. If you want to have a night out at a "cool" place with friends Ra is it.

The bad:
