For the money not the best sushi. But for happy hour you can't beat the deal and this becomes a great value. You will get a great experience. Also it can be packed over the weekend so get there by 5 P.M to catch the happy hour.
They changed there happy hour menu and took a lot off of it. I ordered the tootsie rolls and they were not made the way they used to be. I'm disappointed :(

The service was SOOO bad here. I don't think I've ever given a restaurant two stars but I mean, come on. We made a reservation for Saturday night and our waiter literally forgot about us after we finished eating and tried to flag him down so many times and he kept ignoring us so we finally had to ask the hostess to get us our check, which she did do and he never came back to check on us. We had all of our dishes and plates just left on the table for whole time so we were staring at them and finally had to stack them at home. Maybe he was the only one working in our area that night? Who knows but you'd think they would staff correctly on a Saturday night or at least have him apologize at the end of the meal but he wasn't even around to do so.

It's super upsetting because it's not like this place is cheap. I don't foresee myself coming back here in the future because the hospitality was just plain bad.

Amazing restaurant, loved everything- the vibe , the music, the atmosphere, and, of course, food !! Ordered chirashi bowl and gyoza, very fresh and delicious. Unfortunately don't live in the area , otherwise would've definitely become a regular with such an extensive menu and great service .

PATHETIC!!!
Went to this so called "sushi" place and we sat at the bar for 15 minutes before taking a drink order. Took another 10 to get it. Mind you, this place was not busy.
Ordered a calamari roll and spicy salmon roll which again took 20 minutes to receive without any ginger or wasabi.
The calamari was fair at best but the salmon was "off" and I mean it was very warm which is the last thing you want in raw fish. 
The bartender asked "how was it?" which I informed him the salmon wasn't right and he replied "would you like something else?" And at his point I said " no thank you, just the check". It didn't make sense to wait Another 20 min for sushi that's is mediocre at its best.
Bill arrives....still charged me for the salmon roll.
So I paid it, and went up to the manager and told him the situation, who must be 25 years old max, and he replied "Oh".  Huh??? That's your response, that's your customer satisfaction?? Wow!
I'm not surprised, this place is run by children throughout the entire restaurant.
Weak!!
Lots of awesome roll options for me and husband enjoyed his sushi. Bento box is a great option to try couple different dishes. Awesome patio to sit outside and enjoy food and beautiful weather.

We love this place for date night.  They have plenty of Vegan options such as cucumber roll, avocado roll, veggie tempura roll and the garlic edamame.

The staff is so fun and friendly!  Ask for Nate, he's entertaining and attentive! We always leave full and happy!

Poor service - Dirty tables and they waited until after my order was in for 20 minutes to tell me they didn't have the item I ordered. I have to request a menu to order something else and then they told me there would be a wait because their kitchen was backed up. The food I did order was not very good, very inconsistent.

I had been a regular here and placed fairly decent sized take out orders weekly. The food is always good although they don't always get substitutions right. Since substitutions are sometimes about allergies that isn't super. 
Anyway, I had not been here in a few months because I got really tired of how terrible the young girls taking the orders over the phones were. I decided I would give it another chance and called tonight around 4:30 to place a take out order. I gave Whitney my name and was about to place my order when I was asked if I could hold. 5 minutes later I was still holding and I hung up. 
Management, train your employees on customer service. I doubt I am the only business you are losing!  
It's really sad too when you love a restaurants sushi but the employees can't take a take out order and treat customers properly at off hours. 
Guess next time I'm craving RA I will be driving to old town. Hopefully they are managed better and value their customers their. 
Bye bye Kierland. Too many fails for the least acceptable reason.

I have to say I was a bit nervous going to RA...I hadn't been in quite some time and was afraid it had declined like Stingray (which was a favorite years ago). 
Happy News!! RA is Amazing as I recalled from past years visiting the Old Town Scottsdale location!!! The atmosphere is consistent to the chain...with illuminated red balls bouncing around the ceiling! The service was spot on...welcoming immediately upon arrival, helpful with menu suggestions and able to handle a large group in a great way!! Brice and Kali were Fantastic!! Keeping glasses full and plates of goodies coming!! The presentation of the goodies was spot on and Beautifully crafted! Fresh and delicious....the photos will have you coming in! The service will encourage you to return!! Thanks RA!!

Not my fav place prob like #7 on my list however a great lunch spot late in the afternoon its usaully empty. I like there lettuce wrap thing o and they have alcohol there too after being in Barnes & Noble for hours I get hungry and thirsty what can I say!?!? The one in awhatukee bluuuu 100x worse food wise but thats another review =)

Kowasaki made amazing sushi for us at the sushi bar, and our server, Adriana, was really attentive and so genuinely friendly! 

The sake salmon sashimi is sublime and the ra'llipop roll is one if my favorite types if rolls: no rice and tons of delicious fish!

Overall, a terrific experience, plus excellent happy hour. This place just made it into our regular rotation!

I have been to RA a couple of times at different locations. My main thought is that it is WAAAAAAAY overpriced. $10 for a well martini? REALLY?? One trip, I got 2 drinks, peppers, and one or two sushi rolls (which are relatively small), and I paid $60!! Yes...60 bucks for ONE person to not even get full! I then heard from a friend that happy hour is the best time to go...prices on happy hour items are a bit more reasonable. So...I went to the late night (10-close) happy hour last weekend.

We walked up and saw a few tables of people outside, and inside there were no more than a handful more...good, not too busy. There was one other woman waiting at the host stand so we stood behind her. We stood there...and stood there...and stood there. 

Several times employees walked by; one even gave a polite little head nod which verified that none of us were invisible. However, even after several times of poking our heads around the dining area and toward the bar tender, no host ever came. We even walked around the fish tank at the entrance thinking maybe someone would come over out of concern that we were essentially BEHIND the host table. Nope! 

After at least 10 minutes of being completely ignored we finally gave up and left. That other woman stayed. That was about a week ago. She very well may still be waiting there. We went to a different restaurant where we paid much less than we would have at RA (even at happy hour prices) and where we were served very quickly.

I have had it with RA. Food is expensive and the taste/quality is mediocre...more presentation than substance. They use tricks to make the food appear larger than it is...spreading out the pieces of sushi roll, garnishing with sauces and some items to make the dish appear taller. It looks nice of course, but when you're hungry, the aesthetics don't fill you up! Happy hour was my last attempt at allowing them to win me as a customer...and I never made it past the entrance.

Tuna tataki it's where it's at. 

Ra does a good job with it's Sashimi dishes, but comes up short with it's rolls. The six that my group ordered all derived from Califormia rolls which are safe and boring. 

I ordered:

Tropical Roll with, " Cucumber, mango & avocado rolled & topped with spinach tempura bits, spicy shrimp mixed with masago & mango salsa," Unfortunately the mix was so cold that it was flavorless. I tried to let it sit until last, and ate my other food, but it wasn't good. I ended up leaving it on the table. 

The Ultimate Shrimp Tempura: with, " Spicy kani kama crab mix, cucumber & shrimp tempura rolled & topped with seared tuna & avocado." It tasted like a california with avocado and resembled a rainbow roll. There was little flavor from the shrimp tempura,as the boring crab mix took up most of the roll

Tuna Tataki: "Thinly sliced, seared ahi tuna; served with an onion soy vinaigrette" This happens to be my favorite item on the menu, and is the reason I keep coming back to Ra. The sauce is perfect with the tuna, and it's sliced perfectly. Everything about this dish is perfection.

Overall, RA is a nice place to sit back and relax, but the menu is boring except for a few items. At the table there were 7 items overall, but only one warranted a second bite.

I went here with a friend Shannon I hadn't seen in forever, we grabbed lunch on a beautiful cool sunny day.  Which meant the entire restaurant was sitting outside so we opted to be 1 of 3 groups that sat inside and had the place to ourselves pretty much.

The waitress was pretty nice and pretty patient with us because we spent so much time chit chatting and catching up that she had to return at least 5 times before we were actually ready to order.  My friend picked the place and I decided to give it a try cause I figured a different location might be better but the food was still just okay and the apple martinis were still very very strong.  So strong that she and I had to do some more window shopping for another hour to make sure I was good enough to drive after just one drink which is insane.

The place was very clean, I give them credit for that, but I personally feel for how bland the food was it's too overpriced.  But I'm guessing it's just me because I have many friends that can't stay away from here and love going back for more and more and more.

Very popular sushi bar in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale. Good sushi for Arizona. I had to send a happy hour alcoholic beverage back to the bar for some fixing. Weekend evenings are very busy, can be loud inside and nearby parking space is usually difficult to find, so if possible, car pool.
This place is great! Awesome sushi to choose from and amazing service!! I would highly recommend this place!

We moved into the area from South Scottsdale in the past 3 months and noticed the new location for this RA. I decided to stop in on a Friday afternoon for a late lunch and to check it out. I sat up at the bar and since I went later than the normal lunch time (2pm) it was pretty quite. I ordered a bottle of saki  and the assorted sashimi lunch special and a spicy tuna handroll. The bartender was very personable and service was great. My girlfriend decided to come meet me last minute so I placed her a lunch order before they stopped serving lunch at 3pm and we sat and had a few more drinks. It was nice to see the place fill up by the time we left at 5:30. Everyone was great  and so was the service. We will be back for sure.

Love the atmosphere of this RA. Great sushi and love the happy our saki bombs and sushi.
Saki bombs always start off the night right.
I like this place... the simple fact they restaurant is open until midnight but the bar is open until 1am on a weekdays, I'm up for another round of sushi at 11 PM.

I've been a fan of the Ra Sushi happy hour for some time, and this branch is similar to the ones that I usually go to in Southern California.  The sushi is very reasonable and tasty, and the drinks are cheap.  My favorite happy items include the Calamari Tempura and the Las Vegas Roll.

Place is avg.  Sushi was good but the red sangria saki was bad. Service was sporadic and we had a one plate that they forgot to put the sauce on, and another couple plates they tried to give us which we did not order.   I would try to find another place.
Very good sushi.  As does it's companion in Old Town.  Set in Kierland, very nice atmosphere.  Very predictable menu, no suprises.  Good quality, slightly overpriced, but a great place for a date.

So as Sushi Bars go they will always be 3 stars for me because I don't actually go for the Sushi. My wife had a discount coupon for us to eat at this establishment and since we were in the neighborhood we decided to stop in. The place is very nice and happy hour was in full effect when arrived so that was a good thing. We had the Vegetable Tempura and Miso Soup.....both were very good. The service was decent even though they seated us near the kitchen entrance. I don't know if I need to go back but it wasn't a terrible experience at all so I would recommend it to Sushi Lovers. Eat, Drink, and be Merry, my Friends!!!!!

Bad experience on reservation. Called before we left the house and reserved seats for 15 people, they did not notify us that there's no seat available. We drove 2 hours to try their food and hoping to get  seated on time.  instead, we have to wait 2 hours. We ended up going to the other new ra sushi  at north Scottsdale since there was no wait and food were served less than the time waiting on this branch

Every time I visit this restaurant the service is very slow. We ordered edamames as appetizers and they were served along with the main entree. We ordered drinks as soon as we arrived and the drinks were served half way through the main course. The disappointing part was that the restaurant was not crowded and the server was not even apologetic. The food was good.

Came in for happy hour to meet with some friends.  The specials are mediocre at best.  I enjoyed my simple Jim Beam on the rocks with a spicy shrimp roll.  The roll itself looked like it might of been a training exercise or its just how they prepare happy hour food items (fast and not pretty at all.)  
We enjoyed the patio that had misters and is nicely positioned in the shade after 3p.m.
Best place for sushi. We had Bruce a new server that just started there. He was amazing and the food was excellent! I will be going back really soon! Great service and great environment!

Went there this evening for "happy hour from 3:00 till closing."  We had the yellowtail nigiri, salmon nigiri, spicy salmon roll, spicy yellowtail roll, seaweed salad, tuna nigiri, edamame, and hot sake.

I ate the edamame, seaweed salad, salmon nigiri, spicy salmon roll, tuna nigiri.   The rice was soft but not mushy.   And it wasn't hard, which is from not enough water added when it cooks.   UGHHH!   The salmon nigiri and the tuna nigiri were oh, so fresh.   The spicy salmon roll was quite tasty.    The edamame was, well, edamame.   The seaweed salad was similar to that premade in the grocery stores, but this version was a little tastier.   I didn't sample the rest of the items ordered, but I'm told they were delish.

I'm sorry I didn't take a photo of all of the food, but what is presented is a representative example.

I would go back.   I thought I had been to a Ra Sushi prior, and didn't like it, but with or without being the first time or second, I liked it.

The food was great but our waiter and the ambiance was horrible... Our waiter forgot half our drinks, after we asked twice. We we finally got our drinks they tasted horrible. He then disappeared for 18 minutes - we timed it as a joke but then we were actually getting pissed. Finally, there were only five tables in the inside and they sat us all right next to each other crammed it. Dumb. Go 15 minutes north to Nori Sushi in north scottsdale, much better!
Solid place for happy hour.  The california and tooty maki rolls were good.  Salmon and yellowtail sashimi were solid.  Nice prices until 7PM. Good music.

I enjoy this place at happy hour as they have some really go prices. All of their appetizers are half off as well as a few of their drinks. I do wish they had more rolls on the happy hour menu but hey you take what you can get. You can eat pretty good for less than $10 during happy hour and that includes a beer. Not too shabby if you are on a budget like me! :)
Cool vibe but sushi quality is consistently poor. Great patio so if you want a drink and not sushi this could be your spot.
This server never stopped smiling. Sake goes very well with yellowtail sashimi and spicy yellowtail rolls.

Ordered roasted shishito peppers, short ribs, and a chirashi bowl for lunch.  The chirashi bowl came with miso soup.   The soup was very light  and delicious. Love the shishito peppers.  It brought back my childhood memories.  I've eaten at many Japanese restaurants in the past but this was the first time i have seen it on the menu.   The  chirashi bowl had a few kinds of fish chunks with some vegetables and it was good.  However, the short ribs were dry and had no taste.  It was also cold.  If you have a short lunch time you should not go there.

Okay, okay... I know this is like my 4th update, but things have really changed! RA has really stepped it up with its management and quality of food. I still LOVE their happy hour, and I am here at least once a week with friends. If there is ever a problem- and there rarely is anymore- the management fixes it at once. I still love the garlic citrus yellowtail, and have added new favorites to my list as well, including the crunchy calamari rill, zonie roll, rainbow roll, etc. 
Although I still think most of their rolls are small (the zonie roll, and others), their happy hour prices make them affordable. I wouldn't go here during a regular, non-happy hour time, unless it was for a lunch special. In addition, their drinks are delicious. I like the dragon bite and the blushing geisha. I really recommend going in for their happy hour deals! 
One pointer - I do not recommend sitting in the bar area. The service in that area has not improved, and you can get the same happy hour prices in the dining room area with far better service. The only downfall to the whole indoor area of the restaurant is that it is very, very loud. Also- they could improve their hostesses a little- I don't know if it is a lack of training or what, but they always seem clueless, cold and brash.

You could read the long version or the TL; DR version.  Here's that version, Meh
So we came here looking to celebrate.  Honestly I thought this was another much fancier place, but it was close and the food wasn't bad the last time we came.  We were seated immediately and had reservations that definitely were not necessary for a Tuesday afternoon.  We didn't get a better table because of the reservations and it looks like we missed the happy hour specials.  We ended up getting an appetizer, the Zonie Roll, the spicy yellow tail roll, and the Pacific roll.  The rolls themselves were creative and OK.  The fish wasn't super fresh but the rolls had good flavor to them.  Definitely not a place I'd go to WOW someone, more like somewhere we'd go if we were lazy.  The Happy Hour specials looked cool, and they do a reverse happy hour which is also fun.  Our rolls took FOREVER to come out though, to the point that the birthday party to the right of us with about 15 people got their food first even though we were seated first.  They apologized twice and took a roll off the bill, but still it didn't leave a great taste in our mouths.  The sushi didn't either.  So Meh, we thought it was alright.  Unlikely to be back.  Sushi you remain an elusive mistress in Phoenix.

My favorite sushi restaurant by far.

Happy hour is from 4-7 and amazing. They also have a reverse happy hour late night.

I've had really good service at the Kierland location... 

So pretty at night! Great atmosphere to go out and have some drinks and HEALTHY food with friends.
Thank you Hannah for setting up my wedding party reservation!  Hannah was sweet and helpful! Great staff at this location!

Shopping at Kierland over the holiday weekend & got hungry, so we decided to try RA. I originally saw RA in Old Town, but opted to dine elsewhere. Methinks it was divine intervention that led us here the next day.
 
Their HH goes from 3-7p, Mon-Sat. Now that's a good HH! We ordered a shrimp tempura roll, spicy tuna & rainbow roll. Like previously mentioned on here, I was amazed that they had a rainbow roll on their HH menu. 
 
Our sushi & service was great, AND it was a cheap dinner! We will definitely come back when in Scottsdale.

If you are looking for a sushi happy hour in North Scottsdale as Brigham Young would say: "This is the place".  Although, I don't think he would have a half price cocktail like me :).  Ra has a nice large patio to relax and nosh on some rolls.  If rolls aren't your thang then I would recc the pineapple cheese wonton's and seaweed salad.  I also like their tootie, veggie and dragon rolls.  Wide selection of items on happy hour, great service..winner, winner sushi dinner!

Gotta love it their food! We moved from Texas. This restaurant is there.. I am glad a piece of Texas in here in Scottsdale! I work close by to this restaurant, today we ordered their bento box and poke bowl. Y'all are missing out if you haven't been there! The lady that took our carry out order was pleasant and accommodating. Didn't have any issues when I came to pick up our lunch. Thank you for being awesome!

I usually don't go to RA since the only one that I thought was close to my house was the one in Old Town Scottsdale and the place was not to my liking.  
Recently, I discover their Kierland Commons location which has a great outdoor seating area and it's spacious with their signature red decor.  The other thing I discovered was their Happy Hour menu, which I must say, is probably one of the best in town in terms of prices and offerings.
$1 sake, sushi like salmon and yellowtail for $2.50, generous servings for friend calamari for less then $4, shrimp cerviche for less than $5.  This is my new fav place for happy hour- I can hang out here, eat my full, drink all the sake I want without breaking the bank!

Everything was so good, sushi was amazing, and gyoza was to die for. Amazing service, every one was so nice and attentive. This was our first date as newly weds, and they really pulled out all the stops.

This Ra location has been a staple at Kierland for what feels like ages now... But as of late, service has been extra top notch. I always sit at the bar, and am yet to be dissatisfied. 
Just a few shout outs to some of the excellent bartenders who not only make wonderful drinks, but who make mine and my friends' experiences always memorable:
Ali, Khalid, Danielle, Taylor, or Katie.
A special thanks to Ali. Better than your favorite bartender, and better than your favorite bartender's favorite bartender.

You have a great team, excellent sashimi, and if you're lucky enough to see Sasha (the blonde) running around, then your meal will already be unrivaled.
The sushi was marginal... the service was maybe less.. there was a bird flying around I  the restaurant, and it made me lose my appetite
I could cook a meal faster than they could acknowledge and seat me. So I went to Safeway and cooked, and RA gets a one star review.

My family of 5 visited RA Sushi around 7pm on a Sunday. We didn't have reservations and the restaurant was exceptionally busy so that is where we ran into a lot of snags, or so the server said. We waited for 30 minutes for a table, which was fine because we hadn't seen each other in so long. We were seated and waited another 30 minutes for edamame and miso soup. Our server brought out our rolls in varying order, not timing the dishes at all. The Vegas roll was mediocre at best, overwhelmed by cheap flavors and additives like cream cheese. I got the spicy yellowtail roll which should've been divine, but tasted like tuna salad from Subway. We had to ask the server for wasabi and ginger, sushi house stables everywhere else. The server also forgot one of our rolls and after telling us she forgot it, brought a completely different roll 40 MINUTES LATER. She didn't apologize but instead gave us a voucher for a free app or sushi roll but told my sister "they may not take it because it says it's expired." I just don't get it. For $100 worth of sushi, totally not worth it. Bad service, bad rolls, no hospitality...the polar opposite of my experience with RA Sushi in Chicago.

We ended up going here cause we were in the area and craving sushi. I wish we would have drove a little further cause this place has gone down hill. I used to go here a few years ago and i use to like it. I guess there are so many sushi places now and they are just better than Ra. We got two sushi rolls and i laught when the waitress brought them to the table. These were the smallest rolls I had ever seen and it was not a half portion cause of happy hour or anything. They were as big around as a quarter. No Kidding! I was really wanting to pig out on some sushi rolls but after seeing those we just ordered teriyaki chicken which I have to say was good. Teriyaki is not my favorite but this was alright. I most likely will not be back but if I find myself there I will get a dinner entree and not the sushi. Drinks were stiff and delicous and waitress was good and friendly. Nothing good  to say for the sushi and thats sad when the word sushi is in the name of the restaurant.

Much better...new manager I think?  I've been coming here forever and was about to give up...I am glad I didn't.  Lunch has been great lately, they give you a 10$ coupon every time for the next lunch. Just log in take a survey get a number.....so generous. Huge servings. Hot hot soup, excellent salad. Great sashimi....give them another try. One word to corporate, please remodel the disgusting women's  bathroom...it is dark.  Freezing, music is blaring. The stalls doors are broken, the hot water spigot is broken......I cannot stand this bathroom. It is raunchy.  The walls are a deep disgusting red with shitty shitty art decoupaged to the walls.  This bathroom is nasty....I think you could find the capital to do a redo....I bitch about it enough and will post photos next time I visit. Please inspect your properties.

I'm a tourist in this area but was meeting up with 2 old friends.  Long ago we had all visited Japan together and we were interested in sushi close to where we were.  We did not expect Japan-style sushi in Arizona.  We did not make a reservation.  

We were seated promptly, and had drinks quickly.  It took a bit to place our order but I was with old friends and didn't mind the conversation.  When sushi started arriving and drinks started coming out, the service was efficient and courteous and right on.

This Kierland Commons atmosphere could exist anywhere.  I felt like I could have been in California or Texas or Washington DC.

Freshness is a key ingredient with sushi, and everything on our table seemed to have a hint of freshness.  I'm not rushing back but I also don't live in Arizona.

Jennifer our pirate bartender was more concerned with keeping her dress clean then shaking my martini. 

She realized after she poured whiskey into a glass that the bar doesn't carry ginger and proceeded to ask if she created a concoction of sodas in a glass if it would be acceptable to be compared to ginger ale. 

She had no personality and to make it worse her manager was sitting at the end of the  bar and flirting with college boys with her and ignoring the entire bar. The poor guy near us hadn't even been greeted for almost 15 min!!

The food is good but don't come to this location and expect any ounce of service!

I'm normally not one to rush to a Ra restaurant because I've had better sushi somewhere else but my last visit here was good. Service can definitely improve though because our waiter took forever to acknowledge and attend to us, but the sushi we ordered was delicious. We also enjoyed sitting out on the patio. I would definitely go for happy hour with friends and/or coworkers especially since they have specials!

I was actually with Ashley b from the below review and can verify what she says really disappointing. We thought we would try again last night and all I can say was what a waste of money. 

To start we sat down and the music was blaring like a night club. We asked the server if we could move or it could be turned down just a little. She said " I don't have the authority to adjust music". Also all of the tables outside where covered in old plates and napkins. Probably 5 dirty tables where near us and where not cleaned during our stay as their was only one server for the lounge and patio. Pretty hard to dye your job when you are so short staffed. We finally were moved outside and then had to wait 15 minutes to have a heater turned on. No offense but it's Scottsdale in the winter. Every restaurant in Scottsdale has these on and working in the winter. 

The food didn't make anything better. I had the Vegas roll which took about 30 minutes and my girlfriend had the spicy salmon roll. Which came out once I was done eating about 45 minutes after ordering. Once her food came out she knew it wasn't what she normally has here and walked it back to the server. She received quite a bit of attitude and eventually decided she just wanted to leave and not have another roll.

The manager came out a little while later(he had to finish his sake he was drinking at the bar). He kept asking if we were happy and full and we said yes so we could get out of this poor experience. What I should have said was how can she be full when she walked food back to you as she didn't like it and how can we be happy when we are sitting around 3 dirty tables and waited almost an hour for sushi. 

We use to come here a good amount but our last two experiences where so poor I think we will find somewhere else to go for late night dining. Really a shame as we both work late hours and use to enjoy late night happy hour. I think we would try it again if the management team actually cared and tried to improve the service or maybe schedule enough staff not to burn out the server they have and given decent service.
It was hard to enjoy anything with the music so loud. We ordered a few happy hour items, and the quality has been going down and the loudness has increased. We are done with this place.

Not much is open in Scottsdale at 10pm on a Sunday night.  Did a little Yelp searching and found a few places with late night happy hours... Yard House, Elephant Bar, and RA.  Since RA's happy hour was only on Sunday nights, figured I'd give it a try.  The place was going on, but we were served pretty promptly.  All RA's seem the same to me... the fish is average, the ambiance is good, and if you go for happy hour, it's a steal.  We had two rolls, some nigiri, and edamame and our bill was $19.

Basically, the place is a 3* joint to me.  But they get an extra star for their Red Cross promotion.  With your bill, you can leave a donation on your card, and RA will match it 100%.  And this wasn't a one-day promo, it goes til mid-May!  Not sure if it's nationwide, but definitely come support RA as this is pretty awesome.

Say at the bar for lunch. Taylor serving the bar was very welcoming and made great recommendations!

I had the crazy monkey roll and was impressed that I could dip it in the mango sauce and avoid soy sauce. 

Also, the indoor/outdoor seating arrangement creates a positive ambiance.

Awesome experience from Sasha the food and atmosphere were great only bad thing was the lady next to me at the bar complaining about everything! Don't know what the big deal was but we got here at the same time and I loved everything!

Great trendy Sushi in Old Scottsdale. The yellowtail and chili sashimi is excellent as are the spring rolls with a sweet (almost peanuty) mustard sauce). I also had a roll with crab, cream cheese and shrimp tempura on top - very rich and hard to eat in one piece but delicious. This is my third time here - never been disappointed.

Service is friendly and competent.

I Love this Place !!! one of my FAVS for Sushi !  they have great Bento Boxes for lunch that are resonable priced, my Favorite is the Shrimp Tempura ! Good prices on Cocktails, and Japanese Beer !  if you get on their e-mail list, they will send you coupons, that are $10.00, and $20.00 off, and great to Celebrate birthday's !  Good Service, also !

RA Sushi is a must try when you're in the Scottsdale area!  A beautiful interior with red accents, dark wood grains, and a beautiful bar area make it a comfortable experience.
The Las Vegas Roll was out of this world, as well as a great effort is made on the more traditional California and Rainbow Rolls!
There's a happy hour everyday that includes drinks and sushi rolls.  The Sunday happy hour goes from 3pm-close, which gives you plenty of time for sakes and sushi!
Don't like the new location. Service was slow and speciality rolls were too rich and greasy. Bad choice moving out of Kierland. Probably won't go back.
I love this place.  Tops the sushi places in Las Vegas.

Their yellowtail sashimi had BLOOD on it. The chef said that "it is ok and not a big issue". Who will eat the raw fish with blood on it???? They did not apologize at all and simply gave me an extra piece. The salmon sashimi tasted bad and I could not finish them.

I am a sashimi lover, but this was the worst experience for me. They didn't even clean the fish before serving!! I felt so nauseous that I did not have any raw fish for a while. Also their response really let me down.

My boyfriend and I came here for my birthday. Seeing as I had a choice of anyplace I wanted to eat and I chose to have sushi. Mine you, this is my 3rd time trying sushi, EVER! So he decided to bring me to RA. As an appetizer we ordered the steamed edamame as well as the Pineapple Cheese Wontons. The edamame and the wontons were very good, the pineapple sauce for dipping was bomb. I highly recommend those. For lunch I ended up having the RAcking Roll and the California Roll. I loved the RAcking Roll, very delicious and the shrimp on top of the roll was amazing. I absolutely, loved it. The California Roll just seemed so basic to me, don't get me wrong - it was good. But after consuming the RAcking Roll, I wanted more flavor and taste. All and all, our experience was very good. The waitress was nice and we had great service. I would definetly return again!

I have always enjoyed RA when it was in the Kieran's. This is my first time to the new location. The customer service was very poor starting with the hostess. The food quality also has gone way downhill. I have no plans to return to what used to be a great restaurant.

The slowest service EVER ! Don't get me wrong, they have good sushi but their service is extremely slow. I feel bad for the waitress, she was very  stressed out and apologetic.. they are always understaffed.

We've been going to Ra since my daughter was 6 years old - a family tradition. The best quality here in AZ was at the Kierland location, but they closed that down so we started driving to the one in north Scottsdale that became its replacement. Might be a management thing, but the quality's gone down since that closure. Or maybe that was the time of the corporate buyout. At any rate, we have stopped going as often. Overall the restaurant just went downhill. Family favorites like the tunacado have really suffered - the tuna used to be SO fresh and of such high quality - truly memorable. Now it's the same tuna you can find at any corner sushi bar.  

But the clincher is this .... my daughter's home from college and we went to Ra for old time's sake last weekend. I ordered what has always been the star of the menu, the Hamachi Kama (I know, it's not sushi, but it was AMAZING), only to be told it's been taken off the menu.  

Big misstep for Ra... just one of many but this last one was sort of the nail in the coffin. At this point there is no reason to go to Ra anymore. Hamachi Kama was the last thing they did truly well - the item that set them apart from the other 50+ sushi joints in this big city. Sure, others have it, but no one does it quite like Ra did - sizable, fresh, broiled to a beautiful crisp without overcooking the center, and the sauce they served it up with was unique and stellar. Good enough to cause cravings... why would they eliminate the last great thing on the menu?

Disappointing to see this trajectory, but it looks like it's goodbye to Ra after all these years.

Positive: 
Still great food and great service. Beautiful decor and the bathroom is way much nicer than in the old location in Kierland. My fave one is Barachirashi used to be "lunch sashimi assortment" still the same delicious flavor is just different name.

Negative:
The new location in NORTH SCOTTSDALE
Is not as intimate as in the old location. If you sit at the patio during the lunch time forget it, it's very noisy from the traffic on the road and the air traffic from nearby airport.

If you wanted to have intimate/quieter lunch /dinner, sit inside and enjoy your meal.
love this place. We were a group of 4 and tried four different kinds of sushi rolls and all were amazing :) would definitely recommend this place for anyone wanting sushi.

We love coming here for happy hour. The service staff is very attentive the sushi is great and the "rock n roll" music on the patio is fun. We always have a good time at the location in Kieland. Try the shishisto peppers. Excellent!

Pros: trendy scene, good music, nice atmosphere, and one of the greatest happy hours in the valley
Cons: very mediocre sushi, not very authentic, trendy scene (if hip young Scottsdale 20-somethings don't do it for you)

You make the call.

I like this location a lot better than their old Kierland Commons one which has since closed. Pro tip: sign up for their email club and you'll receive a free bento for your half-birthday. We always order their bentos for lunch because they are a pretty good deal. I've tried their unagi (fresh water eel) once but the price was too steep for 2 pieces. Their tempura is phenomenal- the best I've tried in AZ. Great portions too!
It's good and staff was nice and attentive. Nice bar area. Patio is large, good place for large groups. Although right next to the road so it can loud.

Great place for on-point Japanese fare! They offer universally known sashimi, rolls, hand rolls, etc as well as their house specialties.

But on a personal note, this venue is a jinx for me in the dating world. Every single, bloody date I have here ends up a shit show! I always figure it's a safe, non-threatening place for sushi in exotic decor.

But with all of the bad dates, I haven't had a bad sushi roll here. Do they salt their Edamame too much? Yeah. Are their prices a tad on steep side? Sure. But, I still dig 'em.

I will eat here again, but only in the presence of well-known fam and friends.

When it comes to sushi my eyes are ALWAYS bigger than my stomach and I just can't seem to avoid spending a tiny fortune, drats!

I hadn't been to Ra in a severely long time and was pleasantly surprised and wonderfully satisfied upon this recent re-visit!

Items we ordered that I care enough to remember and am salivating at the memory are: 
Beef Tataki Roll - artichoke, asparagus, roasted red pepper & avocado rolled & topped with seared beef, served with creamy wasabi & drizzled with black pepper soy
OMG!
Mango Lobster Roll - lobster mix, avocado & cucumber rolled & topped with thinly sliced mango, served with mango-tobiko & kiwi-wasabi sauces
So Yum!!!

It was OK, but I remember it being much better. Met a friend there for dinner and should have chosen a different place just for the noise level. The place is loud, so I'm officially old. The bar is right in the front and was packed at 7 on a Saturday, but they sat us right away at the sushi bar. The service was quick and the sushi chef was helpful, though it was hard to hear him (again, old). 

My wife and I had the 'RA'llipop, RAckin Roll, Chili Ponzu Yellowtail, toro nigiri, salmon nigiri, king crab nigiri. My buddy ordered a watermelon and kiwi salad with shrimp and sushi that I lost track of. When we asked the sushi chef about salmon skin he told us it was 'kind of like bacon' and made some for us to try (no, not like bacon...).

The RAllipops and the Chili Ponzu were the standouts of the evening and the toro nigiri and king crab nigiri were a bit of a disappointment. The toro was a little fattier than I like (I know, some folks like that), and the king crab had a lot less flavor than I'd remembered it having and tasted a little like refrigerator. 

I would have given four stars (the service was five) but for the value. I really expected knock out sushi. It was 'good sushi', at a 'great sushi' price point. (And too loud for this old man).
I adore RA!  They have a great selection of sushi.  Go for Happy Hour.  Its only a couple of hours, but you really get some great items for pretty cheap.  You can even get a large Asahi for about $5!

We won't be back. This was by far the worst service we have received in a long time. We went for a late lunch, arriving at 1:50, nobody even brought water to the table until 2:05, and we had to ask for it. The server that took our drink order initially refused to do it because "it wasn't his table." Well, he took our drink order, someone else took our food order, a third person brought our food, had to flag down the hostess for a water refill, and then they "had to get our softshell crab roll on the fly" because "the kitchen messed up."

Um no. The waiter(s) messed up. Don't blame the chef for not putting the order in. Honestly, we have given Ra a few chances over the years to redeem themselves, but when two people spend $60 for lunch we expect much better service. 

The food was fine. Ra, for just "fine" food, this really isn't worth it.

Ra is a sushi classic in AZ. I love everything here except the calamari, the thick pieces just aren't my thing.

The service is decent and the menu is simple, great happy hour!

I'm only giving this place 2 stars because the food was just ok.  The service was some of the worst I've ever experienced. It was early around 5:00pm and the hostess wouldn't give us (wife and 3 yr old) a booth because they were saving it for a party of 5 or more, but the interesting thing is that they seated a party of three after us and the other booths were empty up until the time we left.  

Our waitress really could care less if we enjoyed our food or if we wanted more.  My wife had god knows what in the bottom of her water cup and nicely asked her for another water, no sorry or here's your water she just put it down on the table and walked away.  We ate and she didn't check to see how our food was and if we needed anything.  About 30 mins later she said to us you're done right, can I bring your check...I'm thinking to myself no desert or do we want anything else???  

Now the food, they had plenty of sushi chefs and our crunch rolls tasted like they had been made and put in the walk-in for an hour.  The fish was cold, but the quality tasted stale. I have been to RA in California countless times and the experience was completely the opposite and went there all the time.

Not going back here and if you go buyer beware.

We have tried to go to this location twice now. This time we made a reservation online, after which they called us and said "sorry we can't take your reservation." We will not be going back to this location, and likely not back to another Ra again.

Always a good experience here. We only seem to come when we have $20 half birthday certificates and our waiter is usually the same guy (hi Jimmy), but no complaints. I love coming during happy hour and getting more bang for my buck. We love their "RA"ckin' shrimp appetizer, the sauce is so good. Sushi is always reliable. Out of the desserts I've tried, I love the banana split maki. The mochi is okay and the fried gelato wasn't as good as I anticipated.
Good selections.  Food good.  Happy hour specials.   Indoor and outdoor seating.  Open late.

I don't know what has happened to my beloved Ra Sushi Bar... I have been coming to RA for as long as I can remember, but over the last couple of years things have really gone down hill for them. But when they recently relocated from Kierland Commons to down the street a bit, I thought why not give this place another shot.
Service was spotty, food was average at best when I actually got it ( waited over 20 minutes for an order of edamame). I was so hoping that things would have improved but if anything they have gotten worse. 
It's a solid spot for HH, outside of that I would skip it!

While I don't consider myself a sushi connoisseur, I do know good service. I'm always willing to give you the benefit of the doubt and cut you some slack, but when there are only 4 tables and the place is empty, cmon. It seemed there were more workers than customers and it literally took 1.5 hours for dinner. Wtf. 

10 minutes just to get waited on. Another 15 for him to come back to take our order. All pepsi products, no dr pepper or pibb (ugh!). Even the sushi on the happy hour seemed outrageous. 

With so many sushi places, no real reason to come back here. Too expensive, too poor of service, good food I guess, but most sushi tastes the same to me.

I love the food here!  The sushi is always so fresh and delicious, and everything has such great flavor. The staff is always friendly, although possibly not trained the best on the official terms of ingredients in their dishes.  You can always find a table with a minimum wait. Their happy hour is fantastic. I love it!  This is a staple in our rotation of restaurants.

Ordered Mai Tai, a drink I typically only get at APAC-Themed restaurants. Bar messaged through waiter, "No Go." Really? Sensing that we'd better stick to simpler drinks, ordered a vodka Martini, dry, olives on side. It arrived warm! Third try, I hunted down our waiter, and ordered Sake and finally discovered the bartender's strength.

We had a group of about 15. Too large for one waiter, but management must have been inspired by bartender's limited imagination. Despite the slow service, we were resigned to our one server.

Leaving, I asked the hostess to please call a cab for the remaining half dozen guests in our party wishing to leave. "Cab?" She asked, cocking her head like an inquisitive Spaniel. "Yes, a Taxi," I replied hoping to select a term in her vocabulary. She stared, blue eyes in the headlights of antiquated language: I may as well be asking for a "Carriage."

We left using Uber.
Decent, the happy hour is good.  The patio is nice and food is generally good!

Visiting Scottsdale and was craving sushi!  This was definitely an excellent choice.  If you are looking for a quiet sushi spot, this is not it, great music, atmosphere, and folks having a good time!  We live in Viva Las Vegas so of course we had to try the Vegas Roll and the Yellowtail Roll was absolutely delicious! My absolute favorite was the Sashimi Salad made with Tuna, yellowtail, salmon and shrimp tossed with mixed green seaweed, cucumber, and avocado!  What's not to love?

The most recent time I went to RA, the hostess was MIA so I walked past the entrance and stood awkwardly at the bar for a few minutes. A girl whom I assumed to be the hostess walked by me and I smiled dumbly, hoping she would assume I needed help... but she smiled and kept walking. So I walked back to the hostess counter and stood there waiting for her to acknowledge me. Basically every time I go it's a version of this story.

The sushi is cheaper than Stingray and better than Sapporo, but I almost need to prepare myself for battle to just get a meal there.

Ra has a hip fun setting and they are open late which is a real plus for this night owl. On the other hand it can get a little pricey and it's not the best sushi I have had. I would recommend coming in during happy hour or getting there lunch card and coming in for lunch. They offer a lot of fun and creative rolls which you won't find anywhere else such as the Arizona roll or my friends favorite the Crazy Monkey Roll. Overall if you want a young atmosphere with some good sushi RA is your place.

Was going to Ra when they only had one store in Scottsdale.  They still have a great ambiance and the food is consistent.  Not my favorite sushi but as a place to go for happy hour and to hang with friends, I recommend it highly.  Patio is great and Kara is one of the best and nicest bartenders you will ever meet.

Really like RA for what it is. I know it's not so "authentic" to the sushi purists, but the presentation of the dishes is pretty and the seasonings are terrific and everything tastes great.

Dustin has been my server a couple times and he does a fabulous job. Plus he has great skin! In fact, being lovely seems to be a server requirement here, because they all are.

The drink and food menus are very creative and extensive,  so plan to spend some time perusing. 
If you are a hot, spicy pepper freak,  be SURE to order the shishito peppers!  They are a meal in themselves. 

My only complaint with this place is that sometimes (well, frequently) you have to wait awhile for someone to show up at the hostess desk to seat you. This is also true for the downtown Scottsdale location. ...and they have lovely servers, too. I'm sensing a corporate theme here.

BEST sushi and one of the best happy hours in the Phoenix area! Definitely come for happy hour as the deals cannot be beat.  My favorites are the RAckin' Shrimp and the Las Vegas roll. Both are unbelievably delicious.

My mouth is watering just thinking about it....

Its everywhere so its hard to say all you can write is about certain locations, right?

Well I go to the one in Old Town scottsdale a bit but mainly in Kierland so thats what this is about.

smile hour- is great , they offer super deals on drinks and food during the happy hours so you cant beat it.

Service and smiles- I highly recommend sitting at or in the bar for the best service. The ladies seem to have worked there for a long time and rock out the drinks and conversation.

Aroma- although most sushi places have a smell to them the down side of sitting at the bar is you get the normal smells plus thestale beer of the bar, but I think its such a great place , you get over it real quick. PLus you can always sit on the patio and people watch , which is the BEST!

Nom Noms- Miso soup, Las Vegas Roll( not my fav but every person I know lves it) , caterpillar rool and any sashimi, will always be fast and fresh. Never a complaint there.

Break it down Jess- Its corprate so they cant really screw up but of all the RA's I have been to cleanliness, service, staff and vibe, this is by far the best . Hopefully I will see you there.

Had lunch here the other day....the food was good. My husband had the New Zealand roll and I had the Salmon Teriyaki so I could try a benton box which I had never had before.....it was nice but next time I think I will order a roll as I sampled some of the New Zealand roll and it was delicious. The music was fun but just a little too loud....it was killing my appetite and making me want to go dancing instead! lol There were a few nice wines to choose from on the menu and our waitress was very good!....will return again.

I think it's very hard to find good sushi in this area but it was a good, dependable place to get your sushi fix. My friend got a lobster soup that was kind of sour and too hot for her. I'm surprise they didn't have vinegar or coconut milk to make it less spicy. I ordered a roll which had spicy tuna and cream cheese and it was yummy. My boyfriend ordered a sashimi salad which was very tasty. The service was very good.

I really enjoy coming here for the happy hour/reverse happy hour. The staff is hit or miss, if you a have a good one then you will be well taken care of unfortunately if you have a bad one prepare to wait forever to even order. 
I'd love a few more vegetarian options on there but I definitely make do with what they've got. Drinks are usually good but sometimes a little strong for me, but I'm a wuss so people who like to taste the alcohol will like them a lot. :) 
They aren't really prepared for younger kids to come in so keep that in mind if you are bringing family. Oh. and its ALWAYS really loud with the music.

I came here on a Sunday afternoon, around 2pm. Bartender was very nice. But, that's about all I can say that's positive. I hear that they have a good happy hour menu, but unfortunately I wasn't there during their designated times. As a result, I paid a huge premium for very average at best Sushi. My nigiri salmon was so fishy that I wondered if I should be eating it raw. The rolls were assembled poorly with sloppy rice bits everywhere. The overall experience was disappointing, to say the least. I realize you are going to pay a premium at Scottsdale Quarters because the restaurant's overhead must be out of control. But at least put a good product on the table.

We came here this past Sunday for lunch.  The place was well lit and open for 11:30 AM.  Service was great and we were seated quick.  I was craving sushi, so half of our party decided on about six rolls. Yes...six!  

In waiting for our rolls we ordered some garlic edamame. Holy cow was that good!  I was glad to see they served Pepsi since nearly all places serve Coke; though I did get some iced team. Good stuff!

I ordered some of the best rolls I have ever had.  It was just delicious!  We will be back!

We went there on 4/16 for a date night and had never been to a RA Sushi restaurant before. We made a reservation because we didn't know what to expect, since it was also on the other side of town from us. Turns out, we didn't need the reservation, they started getting busy around 7pm and we had gotten there a little earlier to take advantage of happy hour specials. We started out with some spring rolls - not much flavor and they reminded my husband of frozen spring rolls from a grocery store. Then we had the chicken katsu, viva las vegas roll, and the king crab roll. Other than the spring rolls, our food was great!! Our server was awesome and very personable too. Will definitely go back and hopefully snag a patio table!

The wife and I are hanging out at Kierland doing the window shopping thing and it's time to eat.  Sushi sounds good!  Oh' look it's RA Sushi!  (Ok so we rarely have a plan...)  Just so happens it's happy hour and there is some live event being video taped for channel 3 TV.  Place is packed with silk and the men who love them....to our amazement we were seated right away albeit next to the kitchen but oh well...

RA is a place for redefined sushi, tetaki, sashimi and assorted japanese style choices...we tried most of their specialty plates from the happy hour menu and a couple of signature rolls from the menu.  I tried to dislike the food, but, it's good!  And you cannot beat the prices for happy hour!  

Turns out the taping was a charity event for a young man battling cancer, proceeds from a special menu were being donated by RA.  Kudos for that!

RA isn't my kinda thing but I would go back for happy hour or late night...the scene is a little too moda LA for me.

Had dinner here last night with my best friends. Great food and drinks. Wade, the gm took care of us after a mix up with the wait staff. We come here often and will be back for the way he handled the situation. Thanks Wade.

A local favorite sushi place of mine. As are all their locations. Nothing can beat their happy hour and the red lights hanging from the ceiling give it a dark cozy atmosphere. I would recommend the Mango Margarita off the happy hour menu as a good choice. Great date place.

We hit this Ra at least once a week. Happy Hour has the best prices and offerings. Our favorites here are the Seared Ahi, Rackin Shrimp and all the Poke offerings. You can't go wrong with Ra, it's a tried and true favorite. The best bang for your buck is definitely daily happy hour 3-7 pm.
I love RA's happy hour! And their patio is great for a gathering!! I definitely recommend getting an array of rolls and other appetizers.

Horrible horrible service by Danielle.  We sat there for 10 min. She gave us menus. 
She Never said anything to let us know she would return. 
When she did return we order waters and Asked if we could order our food. 
We had a small window and already waited 10 min. 
She threw her ice scoop and said "we all have small windows". We got up and left. 
The people around us couldn't believe it. 
I'm a bartender. I know what it's like when you are busy. Vocalize to YOUR CUSTOMERS!! It's not that hard!!! She is a rude person with a horrible attitude. We will not return in your establishment. 
There is ZERO reason to be treated that way! 
Danielle You work for tips! 
Maybe YOU need a BIG window in customer service.

First off - sushi in Phoenix?1? At least, that was what I was thinking when I walked by this place, which looks like a decent place to stop in, but I will admit, I hesitated a bit. After glancing at the menu and seeing the sushi that was on peoples' plates, though, I was convinced it was worth a try.

If you're staying at the nearby Westin Kierland Resort, this is totally worth it - prices are good, beer is cold, and they have a huge menu, full of options for everyone, even the non-sushi eaters in your party. (I was visiting with a total vegetarian friend, and he said his meal was great...)

I started off with the garlic edamame. I know, you are asking yourself, "What the hell is GARLIC edamame?" It's awesome stuff, is what that is. You need it. Get it. It has a bit of a bite to it, but it's hardly prohibitively spicy. It's loaded with garlicky spicy goodness. Great choice.

Then, I proceeded to order about 1/3 of what I usually get, in order to get a feel for their quality. I ordered 2 pieces each of salmon roe (ikura), fluke (hirame), yellowtail (hamachi), and salmon (sake) nigiri, expecting middle of the road quality fish that was at best OK. Surprise! It was awesome! The quality of the fish I had cannot be overstated. Each piece of sushi was served at the correct temperature and was a smooth mouthful of deliciousness - this is no fast food or supermarket sushi joint. I just had to go back and get more hirame and hamachi; they were that good. I also indulged in their crunchy calamari roll, which I must say is a bit gimmicky, but also totally delicious - go for it.

We finished with their version of a creme brûlée, and it was tasty. Overall, a super unexpected find. I had to force myself to try a different restaurant the following day for lunch, because I could totally see myself coming here for ALL of the meals during the conference. I am happy to say - YES, sushi in Phoenix!!

Here for lunch, as always service is excellent, food is consistent (keep in mind we've only ever ordered sushi).

This time around we notice that they got rid of the Sushi sheet and pencil where you can mark your order and just give to the server. I would think it's quit a bit harder on the server, especially if your party is ordering a lot. I also took note that the menus were redone to incorporate the calories to all the items (which I loved). We ordered Green Tea and a Kirin. For Sushi, we ordered Sea Urchin, Salmon, Smelt Eggs with Quail Eggs and a Yellow Tail Sashimi. All the fish was fresh and tasted good.

Always good to have a spot to stop by for a quick bite to eat for lunch.

New HH menu on 12/21/11. Pacific roll for $6 is a steal & very good. 

The very few TVs they have are actually monitors, not HD TVs, and have no sound/closed captioning. Really sad.

Place needs some maintenance (ie soffit above bar is literally held together by duct tape).

Service @ the bar is OK but not great.

I'm not sure why I keep going back to this location. The food is good, but it's not so great when it takes 45 minutes to get on a Tuesday night when my server only has 2 other tables. Then when we asked for the check it took another 20 minutes for that! Every single time I come here the service is either slow, or the servers are extremely passive and rude. I likely won't be coming back. The staff is lucky I am a server as well and believe in karma or else I would have left close to nothing for a tip.
I love, love, love their garlic edamame! I have had them at other sushi restaurants but nothing can compare! I wish they bottled their sauce!! Go during happy hour!!

we went to eat here while visiting my hubby's brother. place looked great. you could say it's more of the 'hip' scene. the music playing through the speakers made us all want to go out and do karaoke [seriously, we went all over town trying to find a magic mic haha]. anyway, the food was good, not the best though, but their Las Vegas roll was absolutely delicious. oh and we all felt a bit under dressed, everyone there was dressed like they were at a club. 4 stars only because it took forever for them to bring our order out and there were barely customers there. our waiter was some guy, didn't get his name, but he was like so mellow. He barely came to check on us. i'm pretty sure they were waiting for us to get out because my daughter and niece pretty much were running around like the place was a playground :p 

-california rolls - ok
- rainbow roll - ok
- shrimp tempura roll - good
- las vegas roll - GREAT!
- mango lobster roll [?] not sure what it's called but i loved it and my husband, who's never had sushi before loved it too and even asked for another order of it :)
- green tea ice cream - yummy. no one can go wrong with that!

we pretty much spent over $100 bucks [during freakin happy hour, wtf].

I had made an order through postmates and wasn't sure what to expect ordering sushi Togo . RA made sure it was perfect ! They made everything in their own little containers so nothing would get soggy , labeled everything so I would know what to put on top of what . Seriously the best to go sushi I have had ! Great job !

Met friends here last night for restaurant week. The food was fantastic and the variety offered was a great value. They even included wine or sake. The lobster rolls were very good.
The only negative I found was the waiter had no idea what was on the restaurant week menu or how the whole deal worked. Once he figured it out, he did a nice job.
Amazing amount of food and drink for $30.
Amazing food! Kyle our server was super friendly. We were impressed that the manager came around and offered us desert on the house.

We returned by the request of Wade the General Manager.  He made sure everything was more than perfect.  We want to thank him for his professionalism and attention to detail.
We will return with our large group soon.

25 minutes no drink they brought the drink  I haved
 a spicy Margarita terrible send it back another half an hour for food stay away from this place go to sapporo's terrible what more can I say. Screwed the food order up to they sent salmon instead of tuna oh yeah I ordered ice cream another 20 minutes
The Las Vegas is a mouth full you may not want to try to eat this if your on a first date.The service isn't great but, it's worth a try if your in the mood for sushi

Nope. Sushi wasn't that great, service was meh, hostesses were meh, and patio seating...should be fully covered. Not much else to say other than, meh. Drive down the road and get better sushi with better service at a much better price. Nothing was bad, but if you're going to pay this much, you have better choices.

I love the RA chain, but this RA always has TERRIBLE SERVICE. I can't tell you how often my friends and I come here and are always trying to flag down our waitress despite the empty restaurant.

I love the food (decent sushi, good for groups, girlfriend dates), and happy hour is great! Also, their half birthday deal is amazing, but I come here instead of the better old town location because it's closer to my house.

Other than the service, the sushi chefs are nice and it's very clean. Oh, but I will note that a lot of the time when I walk in and stand in front of the hostess table, the hostess will be missing and I'll have to wait a long time before someone realizes I'm there... 

Cheap sushi, decent quality, bad service, but willing to come back b/c of convenience.

Food was pretty good. Service was pretty good. Host was at best average. It was odd that the items I ordered all came out first so my friend had to eat my food while waiting for her food. Then the one item she ordered came way later when she reminded the server. Green tea was odd tasting, like seaweed. Overall the experience was very average nothing memorable or worth mentioning.

Set inside kierland, the ambiance is good but it feels like your typical chain - good, but not special. There is a nice big patio which is great when there is nice weather and good for people watching!! The staff is always nice, no complaints.

RA has a great happy hour and reverse happy hour, one of the best around! The "ra"ckin shrimp is pretty tasty and very crunchy. I also like the chili ponzu yellowtail, although you can probably find better cuts elsewhere. The sushi never wows me, but it's good, I've never sent anything back, and I always leave full.

Overall, I don't come here for the best sushi in Phoenix, but I keep going back for the happy hour -it's totally worth it!!

I'm not a fan of chain restaurants but this place was pretty good. The lobster spring rolls were really good! We ordered 2 orders of it. I also wasn't a fan of my drink I ordered but I still drank it. My waiter took it off my bill which I wasn't expecting him to do- but that was pretty awesome.
Delicious lunch today!!! Spicy salmon bowl, chicken teriyaki bento box, zoni roll!!! Yummy

The sushi at RA is beyond amazing!  I eat sushi about 3 times a week and if I could eat at RA evertime, I WOULD!  Happy Hour rocks and there's some really awesome stuff on the HH menu!  Absolutely love it!

I love the ambiance of this place! They have comfortable seating, awesome decor, and nice lighting (not the kind for taking pics, but good for a chill night out).  It is great for date night or a girls night out. The service was great--our waitress was the sweetest!  As for the food, I ordered a specialty roll, the crazy monkey roll. Tbh, the sushi was pretty meh. Nothing really special about it but it was still aight. I'd be willing to come back and try another sushi roll or dish because I really liked the vibe of this place.

Not impressed with this restaurant after years of frequenting in the old location. We came here to celebrate a special occasion and sat on the patio. Our waiter was non-existent. We had to go up to the bar to get our own place settings. When we asked a manager about where our waiter went, he said he was being slammed in the inside. So, I guess we were not as important as the 'inside' customers....
The sushi was marginal. maguro on the sashimi plate tasted as though it was freezer burnt, and didn't taste right at all. Miso lacked any flavor at all. We finished our drinks before the main course came out and were never asked if we wanted more beer or sake. What waiter walks away from another bar charge?? 
Won't be coming back.... ever. If I could give this ZERO stars I would. Can I get back the last hour of my life?
Great food great service. Happy hour and martini Monday's are a great deal. Sara was a very friendly server.

Came here with my boyfriend at like 10 pm for sushi which is awesome in the first place since so many places are closed by this time. This is open till 12 and the servers treat you just as well as if you came in at 8! Love when there's no hate for coming at a later time. So when I arrived we were able to choose to sit at a booth  and wre treated very kindly by the darker haired host. I tried the cucumber roll, nothing crazy. I just do vegetarian sushi and a side of white rice. Servers checked up frequently and I only paid like 8$ for this simple little late night snack. The ambiance was very busy and pretty loud for a Sunday night, however I loved it! I didn't get to try an happy hour options but looking at their HH menu I will have to come back asap! Thanks Ra

Was on vacation nearby and just walked in with friends. The food was a real surprise.  We ordered some house rolls that were good, but the yellowtail sushi was the best. Worth a shot if your in the area.

Good but not great sushi,  happy hour make up for that, though.   A newer offering is the 4 dishes for $25.  For 2 people or a small group that's a pretty good deal.  Combine it with the happy hour sake and it's certainly worth the trip

I'm fairly new to the sushi world..so I have had a lot of catching up to do over the last few years. I have tried SO many places and by far RA has been my favorite. Amazing food, affordable prices...especially the happy hour menu and the staff is so friendly and attentive. The manager Kearstin was so nice. She made us feel welcome and made sure everything was ok throughout our lunch. RA is my go to place for amazing sushi and service!
Very good design and set up. Food is okay and the happy hour is pretty good. Service is solid as well.

Ive always enjoyed Ra, and I love the new location and environment since they left Kierland.

However, I feel like their quality has gone wayyy downhill.
I went there the other night and ordered a few specialty rolls. The rice was "mucky" and "mushy".
The scallop dynamite roll had more chunks of onions ontop than actual scallops. It was awful!
This is the 3rd time going there after the relocation that I have had less than stellar sushi. I probably wont be going back.

The other thing I would like to say and this goes out to the management..... I like to go and sit at the bar. Many people (usually women) want to place their purse, jacket, etc on an empty
bar stool to either "save it" or so someone wont sit next to them. This has happened several times when I have gone to RA. If people dont want people sitting next to them, Get a table! Management should take note that these folks that do this are taking up a PAYING CUSTOMERS spot! ANd puh-lease!! SItting at the bar is a fun way to make new friends!!

I never was a fan of RA sushi, I guess I just wasn't ordering the right thing! 

But since they loved to their new location, we've been there many many times and I've enjoyed it every single time! 

Rolls are yummy, their appetizers are creative and delish. 

Great lunch specials and especially HAPPY HOUR! Definitely have been to several!!

So disappointed, seriously some of the worst service I have had in a long time.  Food was good, as RA always is.  I frequently visit RA at other locations, first time I went to this one.  The service we received was the absolutely the worst tonight, it's Monday night at 7pm and hardly anyone there.  Waitress never stopped by to check on us after the food came out, which came out super quick but nothing past that.  Had the Hot Mess, would have been nice to get a refill on water too.  Had to flag her down to pay, so disappointed.  Tarnished my fondness of RA.

Asdfghjjkshsjxbsn ... woo saaaa ... I honestly don't know why I even bothered!! I thought new location so maybe new management/chefs? I guess not. 

I ordered a chicken teriyaki bowl. I can't eat rice so I asked for extra veggies and even gave the waiter suggestions. Basically just fill up my bowl with vegetables since I can't eat rice. Is that too much to ask for?? When my meal came oh I received extra veggies alright, which you ask? Carrots!! The bowl was full of carrots!!! What a friggin joke. The chicken might as well have just been a slab of meat as well - super awkward to eat.

I told the waiter I wasn't pleased when he asked how my meal was, and that it was just filled with all carrots... he said sorry and then asked me if he could bring me a side of broccoli or peppers.... uhhhh no.... but why couldn't you have just added that to my bowl??!!! Ughhh the logic is beyond me.

He offered me a coupon for a free roll or app for the next time I come in... thanks, but no thanks!

I should put this out there: I go to RA a decent amount.  Their Ikura with quail egg and hot sake hits the spot, along with some other great menu options.  Furthermore, the service I've had has always been above par. 

However, my only problem with RA is the loud music.  I love club music and even going to clubs on occasion, but it would be nice if there was at least an area outdoors where the soundtrack didn't feel invasive---especially since I usually go there after work to kick-back.  Friends of mine have mentioned it to me, and we still go to RA for their awesome menu, but the experience would be 5 stars with some more mellow, toned-down tunes.

Loved the fresh sashimi here. Ordered the hamachi sashimi, lollipop roll, and lucky heart roll and all delish. Also had the Japanese mule which was really surprisingly good. My fiancé ordered two different kinds of wings and loved them.
We had great service and the place wasn't even that crowded on a Friday night around 8. We were seated as soon as we walked in. Will be back!

I must admit that I am picky about sushi and I do not love chain restaurants. Living in Colorado, I had no idea RA was a chain...thank goodness. It was so yummy! Our server was amazing and we were her last table of the night.

If you like waiting for the bartender to chat with her friends while waiting to order after sitting for 8 minutes to be acknowledged you may enjoy this location. Especially if you like your food to be delivered to her other friend sitting next you on the other side while he eats it.

This place never disappoints. Karen got fish tacos and I got the sushi & nigari entree. Absolutely delicious.  This is our first visit to the new totally hip location. Big improvement over the old place.
Spencer, our server, very friendly, fast and attentive. Ask for him when you come here. Because it was our first visit he comped an order of edanami.

This will be short and sweet.  Went on Friday night and waited to sit outside.  Was worth waiting for because of the weather.  Service was LAME.  The waiter was so incredibly slow/miserable/uninterested/checked out that it was painful to experience.  His first statement to us was that he couldn't bring us water or plates because he was waiting for them to be cleaned, but eventually we would get them.  But the food was great so I wasn't sure how to rate the place. (hence the 3 stars) Got several rolls, the potsticker soup, and some drinks.  All the food was good and the atmospere was cool as well.  I would go again because I hate to let yummy food go because of a coma induced waiter.
I feel like Ra is too focused on social and not sushi. Good for groups, and decent happy hour prices. Lots of cute waitresses too.

I rarely order a sushi roll that I don't like, but the Rainbow Roll left a little something to be desired. In the description it says it lays down avocado, shrimp, salmon and another fish to make it look like the colors of the rainbow. I thought this meant that every individual roll was going to have all this fish but it was just spread across the 8 rolls. The color of the fish was very bland and there wasn't even avocado slices on each roll. It in no way resembled a rainbow and even tasted more bland then it looked. I really enjoyed the nigiri though and our server was nice just not very attentive. It was pretty slow when we were there and I saw him just standing around talking to other employees. Which is fine cause I'm a server too but when your table needs something and you see your server just shooting the breeze instead of doing their job it's a little annoying. All in all it was an average experience, might come again and try their happy hour and some other rolls besides the rainbow one!

Went in recently to see if service would be any better. It wasnt. We were there for an hour and a half and our server Katie checked up on us only twice, in the beginning and in the end. My friend wanted to return her food because it wasnt what she had gotten but by the time the server came back she had ate it all bcuz she was hungry.. 0_o Happy hour sucks, they took off the onion albacore tuna (my fav) and the veggie tempura. the two things i had came for in the first place! not only that but i feel like they raised the prices to make up for the happy hour prices. ull see all these weird prices like 480 or 710 scatted across the menu. ill go elsewhere.

We've been to Ra on N. Scottsdale several times over the last couple of months. While the food is always good, I have noticed a distinct problem with their customer service. We were at our table for about 15 minutes before our simple glass of wine arrived.  I watched the 2 male bartenders talking non-stop with each other (particularly the husky, shorter, bald guy) while my poor server kept checking back to the bar for our drinks. These 2 guys should have been immediately on all orders, but instead seemed to be having a deep discussion.
We like the happy hour too, but we probably won't go back again because of the extremely poor customer service.

Staff was friendly. Sushi was good. Nothing special about this place. I had the miso soup, edamame, and the GOJIRA ROLL: Shrimp tempura, crab mix, cream cheese and cucumber rolled and topped with spicy tuna and green tempura bits; served with Sriracha and spicy mayo. 
They didn't have a lot of specialty roll options, but overall everything was good. I would go again, but it wouldn't be my first choice. 5 starts for the food and staff.

Located in Kierland Commons, RA is in a great location to dine outside, with a view of the sky high, beautifully lit palm trees and the surrounding action of shoppers and foodies.  On the off chance that the weather isn't Scottsdale-Spectacular, or you love the indoor experience, the ambiance inside is wonderful and alive, as well.  The edamame is a must to enjoy while you're waiting for your sushi.  I always order the King Crab Rolls, since I love the avocado inside, with the cucumber and crab. As with any restaurant in Kierland Commons, parking close can be a challenge, however there is a large parking lot a block to the south, and a large lot and parking garage a few blocks to the north...and after all, walking within this quaint area is part of the experience.
This is the second time I have been to new location. Terrible & slow service every time. Took almost 45 minutes to get a bento box?!? The excuse was they have only 2 cooks hire more people!!!!

Sushi is good. We enjoyed the happy hour specials.

The new location is better than the previous on at Kierland Commons.

The service was solid.

I was with a mixed group of sushi lovers and sushi newbies.  Ra was a great choice to cater to all.  

Atmosphere was loud and lively.  The restaurant was very dark - could barely make out the menus.  Lots of outside seating as well.  The place was PACKED but luckily we managed to snag a table.  

We ordered family style, including spicy tuna rolls, seaweed salad, the Viva Las Vegas, soft-shell crab rolls, tempura, chicken teriyaki, and a few other things that I can't remember.  Even the sushi newbies loved all the sushi items!  They were also turned on to Asahi.  

Our waitress graciously split the bill evenly 7 ways with 7 credit cards and no attitude.  Total came to about $27 each, which was a very reasonable price.    

Would come back next time I'm in town.....
